Reviews.Title: “Fine boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Charles W
Reviews.Content: A perfect alternative to branded hotels . Perfect location close to several nice restaurants and large shopping mall. Reception in hotel was very good and fast , rooms are big enough for 4 people ( 2 adults and 2 children ) and very nicely designed as is entire hotel including swimming pool. My compliments to the entire staff in this hotel everybody working in this hotel was always very friendly and was always ready to help. We will promote your hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel. Excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyNewman
Reviews.Content: First time at the SLS and it wont be the last. Cool, hip, chic hotel with an amazing location. Best part was the service I received from the concierge desk. Particularly Lori. She answered all my questions, set me up on some cool LA things and followed up the next day with a phone call to see how everything went. Was thoroughly impressed by that. Overall enjoyed the experience and plan on returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Sandy B
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the SLS Hotel recently. The hotel front desk staff was very cordial and went out of their way to accommodate my last-minute request to see if I could extend our stay another day. The room was very large and nicely furnished. The roof top pool area was very cool and classy and the service was excellent. Overall customer service was one of the best we have ever experienced. We would definitely stay at the SLS again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Trendy/Funky Hotel in Beverly Hills”
Reviews.Author: aevegan
Reviews.Content: Spent a night at the SLS on a road trip up the coast. I was not too sure what to expect going in but I was very happy with the stay. We were upgraded to a large room with a patio. The rooms have some pretty funky and cool decor. The bed is super comfortable and the bathroom was very cool (think lots of smoked mirrors and stone). The personal care products provided in the bathroom are top notch and the shower was pretty awesome. The general vibe in the hotel is definitely trendy/hip. It was awesome that its located with the Bazaar on site. We had a really great meal with some pretty unique tapas options and great drinks (priced as you might expect, on the higher side). The gym is large and has a lot of cardio, free weight, and Nautilus type equipment. Certainly does the job. The pool on the roof was pretty cool although we just took a walk around. The staff were friendly although there was always a lot of activity at the front desk. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel. I had a great stay and I will definitely be back again.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice experience”
Reviews.Author: kansascem
Reviews.Content: Stayed in SLS five days and it was neat hotel. Ultra modern rooms were a treat. Staff helpful in every way. Food great and presented well. To cool to take in the pool on the top but we looked at it and it looked like a fun to place to relax. Rooms are a little dark but lighting was unique in our room. Mirrors everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Two fabulous and memorable staff members”
Reviews.Author: Margaret M
Reviews.Content: I travel all over the world on business as I'm sure many of you reading this do and we all have horror stories to tell. BUT - I stayed at the SLS 2 weeks ago and Danielle and Aaron at the front desk could not have been more helpful, polite, professional and more fabulous if they tried!!! And it wasn't just at check in - over my 3 day stay, they remembered my name, said hello every time I passed by and were "consistent in providing great service". Whenever I'm in LA from now on - this is my "GO TO" hotel. Margaret McMahon

Reviews.Title: “Yes it is wow but it also has some....wtf...to go along with it..”
Reviews.Author: Duke_Fairfax
Reviews.Content: So every hotel has its great features and not so great features...I stayed at the hotel for a week, Wed to Wed March 21-28. The hotel does have a certain amount of "hollywood flash" but I think it has more to do with Jose Andres' restuartant The Bazaar next door than the hotel itself. Pros- Has a chic design Friendly front desk staff. (treat people how you want to be treated and they will respect you for that) Was upgraded to larger room. Design in room is very nice The Bazaar, ate there twice...def try the desert bar. pretty cool Valet guys were awesome Cons- Traffic, its a busy hotel so can get a bit chaotic when pulling in Concierge was not very helpful. Room is chic but needs updating. caulk in bathroom is splitting and changing colors. i would say the hotel would of been awesome a few yrs back but things need to be fix/managed...low lighting does not mean guests will not see. I think everyone had a comment on lighting. its ok...could be a bit brighter but i get the idea so not really going to complain about that.... Overall, great hotel, would stay there again....like i said, tip and treat the staff how you want to be treated and you'll have a great time/experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice slick modern hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: SMillington
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at the SLS for 1 night and the hotel definitely presents a different experience from anywhere we have been before, which was exactly what we were looking for. The hotel has a very contemporary appearance, crossed with very quirky fixtures. Check in was very efficient and our room was exceptional; ultra modern with great amenities. We visited the pool terrace early in the afternoon and just about managed to get two spaces. People who arrived later werenâ€™t so lucky, however, looking around most of the beds were unoccupied by people who had just left towels, which caused a lot of complaints that we continuously over heard. Whilst I am not complaining in our case, had we arrived later we would have been equally frustrated having made our booking purely on the basis the hotel has a pool terrace. In my opinion I think the management should reduce the turnover time of unoccupied beds to minimize this problem. All the staff at the hotel are very friendly and accommodating and on check out helped with checking our flights without having to ask. Overall a good experience and fairly good value for money!!

Reviews.Title: “Stlylish, Sophisticated, and Sumptupous Spa”
Reviews.Author: Abigail S
Reviews.Content: I had the most amazing experience at Ciel spa at SLS last weekend. The staff was so welcoming and accommodating, I never wanted to leave! Their "waiting room" is referred to as the "relaxation lounge" and that, it definitely was. Carol, my massage therapist was so nice and not too chatty (a big pet peeve of mine at a massage appt.). From the minute I got there until check out with Nicole--super sweet and knowledgeable receptionist (i cannot wait to try her product suggestions!!)--I felt relaxed, welcomed, and surrounded by elegance. The white hallways with simple floral arrangements were remarkable and the atmosphere was calming and luxurious. I absolutely cannot wait to go back for more treatments!!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Guaditaworldwide
Reviews.Content: Im a very frequent traveler, Im on the road 3 weeks per months. I love cool hotels and always look for the best to stay. This is THE ONE when going to LA. Great room, great food, excellent staff, location and the perfect touch of glamour and cool decoration. Try the Spa!

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the SLS”
Reviews.Author: Gardengal4
Reviews.Content: I have to admit, I was a little concerned after reading some of the reviews on the SLS. My daughter won a trip to Beverly Hills and accommodations at the SLS. I really wanted it to be extra special. The service was wonderful, check in/out a breeze. I was afraid of feeling a little out of my element being such a fancy hotel, but that was never made to feel that way at all. Our only issue we had was with the bad lighting in the rooms. It was hard to put your make on and get ready.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and Clever”
Reviews.Author: JMG0005
Reviews.Content: The SLS is the only hotel in LA for me. I have stayed at all of the "hipster" spots but have never experienced the level of service and sophistication that I find upon each visit to SLS. Between the ever accommodating staff, the excellent food and the uber-sexy decor, there are no aspects of this experience that left me wanting for more. The word that most comes to mind when thinking of the brand is clever. Whether it be the sayings behind the reception desk or the mini-bar selections/concepts - it is clear that this is a hospitality group that invests considerable time into perfecting its branding. I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “fun and different hotel with amazing staff and great restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Mary345
Reviews.Content: The SLS is a different hotel located in the middle of everthing and a short ride from the center of beverly hills, with the price tag to match, but its a fun scene with a great weird design and amazing food-especially at Bazaar which is busy at night. yes it is very very dark as everyone says, especially in the room which was clean and modern but not as functional with the design. the staff is wonderful and attentive and really make you feel special, particularly Aaron at the front desk during check in who was helpful and nice and Danny the bellman who took time to sit with us explaining the local map and help plan what activities to do nearby, including dinner at Bazaar. he and everyone is right- amazing place to eat, even if pricey- its a must do! overall great and different place to stay with a great staff and fun night scene.

Reviews.Title: “You either love it or you hate it”
Reviews.Author: Oliviauk
Reviews.Content: Arrival at the SLS was impressive. The valet parking and the welcoming was first class. Check-in took longer than I would have wanted as I had booked a suite and the front desk manager had to release the room before the staff could allocate one to me. The reception area is dark and quirky. As I went up to the room, the eclectic hotel design was visible at every corner. The room was large but dark. The bed in the middle of the room provided an excellent nightâ€™s sleep. Unfortunately the room was behind the pool table and facing the room so was noisier than I would have liked. The bathroom was of a good size but did not have a bath tub. I did not miss it but would expect a room in the $500 category to have one. The darkness in the bathroom is a design fad but not practical. The gym is state of the art. Although it gets busy the equipment is one of the best I have seen in a hotel. The food in the restaurant was excellent and the staff attentive. The breakfast buffet was disappointing. The quality of the food and the staff were great but the choice was far too limited for my taste. Breakfast only starts at 7am so if you have an early start you will only be able to get complimentary coffee. WiFi works well. The hotel charged me $14.95 per day per device. When I complained at check-out the charge was reduced to $14.95 per day. The SLS is not cheap. The amenities and the standard of service is what you would expect in this price category. Overall the stay was enjoyable and the staff excellent but after 3 nights the design and darkness become overpowering and I was pleased to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service, good location”
Reviews.Author: Michael B
Reviews.Content: This hotel provides great service as everyone says. Always greeted nicely when returning back to the hotel. Especially received great service from Danny (bellman) and Lori (concierge). I also agree with the comments about the lighting in the room, it doesn't get bright but the bathroom is big and the full size soap and shampoo is valued. The only negative is the restaurant we only ate in the restaurant for breakfast one day and even though it is a luxury hotel found the breakfast overpriced and not that good. We preferred to walk a block down to Coffee shop for breakfast after that. Good enough for us. Would recommend to all to stay here for service, room was clean and always well serviced and maintained. Car always ready when called down to be ready.

Reviews.Title: “Warm friendly reception. What great service that is sincere”
Reviews.Author: Fozzdogg
Reviews.Content: A special thanks to Ani at the front desk, she went the extra mile to make our stay great and make my son feel at home in Beverly Hills... Thank you again, we can't wait to return. A. BIG thank you to Lori our concierge your recommendations for the Parlor sports bar and golf made our trip. Thank you All

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel and personal service”
Reviews.Author: karen a
Reviews.Content: The SLS Beverly Hills is one of the best hotels i have ever stayed at. The location is fantastic, the rooms decadent, and the personnel wonderful. The hotel staff could not have done more to make my stay pleasurable. My review is 100 % positive because that's what my stay was. Do yourself a favor and stay at the SLS Beverly Hills.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Weekend Getaway, with AMAZING Spa Services ...”
Reviews.Author: Dana S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just wanted a weekend getaway, to relax and be briefly away from our hectic day to day schedule and lives. We booked a room at the hotel (wonderful deep tub where the water flows into the tub from the ceiling!). And enjoyed a cheese plate and champagne via room service and then dinner at Bazaar. Bazaar! Heaven. The next morning, right before we left I booked a facial at Ciel. Sebastian told me right before he started that I would literally see a difference in my skin at end end of the facial. I didn't believe him. He was right. It was a facial that incorporated light and some form of gentle current. I am a skin care and facial junkie and this was the best ever. Pinky swear! Love you, Sebastian! DanaS

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Cindy A
Reviews.Content: Pros: Beautifully weird decor. Nicely spaced room. Delicious slice of chocolate cake since we were celebrating a birthday. The swimming pool area is gorgeous but I wish that the actual size of the deeper pool was bigger. Staff was professional and attentive. Complimentary wifi and water if you are an SPG member. Great location - a 3 minute walk to Beverly Center and Matsuhisa. Delicious drinks and tapas at The Bazaar by Jose Andres. Cons: The brown leather couch in the room was a stained. Housekeeping need to check on the lighting before we checked in because 2 of the light bulbs went out and we were going crazy trying to find the switch for it. SLS is a dog friendly hotel, and a few rooms across from us had a dog, and the dog was barking nonstop.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect lunch and Spa day with the girls”
Reviews.Author: t c
Reviews.Content: We had a little get together to celebrate my upcoming twins' arrival for lunch at Tres and then a spa session at Ciel Spa. Both were wonderful! Lunch was complimented by delicious mimosas (not for me of course!) and very reputable food. The spa was luxurious and very comfortable, and the massage was super relaxing!

Reviews.Title: “first experience at the Sls Hotel”
Reviews.Author: benny b
Reviews.Content: Would love to thank the friendly staff for the warm hospitality, wonderful service for the moment we pulled into the valet. Special thanks to the young lady whom checked us in a the front desk< Thank You Ani Karian

Reviews.Title: “Love, love, love SLS”
Reviews.Author: Tcrenshaw
Reviews.Content: I have fallen in love with the SLS. It's chic, it's modern yet the service is old fashioned quality. You'll feel well taken care of by the front desk. Decor is important to me and the decor here is detailed, comfortable and inviting. I might even add surprising. You'll have to just see for yourself. The food in the lobby bar is tasty and beautifully presented. Even the room service was great. We've had a a block of rooms here for our consulting team for several weeks. And despite a few hiccups with room assignments and arrival arrangements, it's been a nice experience. Kudos to the sales team for all of their attention, quick fixes and the little extra touches they've put in place to make us feel welcome. I would recommend SLS to business travelers and vacationers alike.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: Raffi B
Reviews.Content: We stayed there recently and everything was wonderful. Great service all around, particularly Ani at the front desk. She was very helpful and high spirited

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience - One Not to be Missed”
Reviews.Author: Lisa M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the SLS Hotel Beverly Hills recently and found the service to be extraordinary. The experience was top notch from start to finish and everyone (I mean everyone) was gracious, helpful and did everything they could to make me feel like I was the only person in the hotel. From check in to check out and everything in between I could not be more complimentary about this wonderful experience. In particular Marketing Manager Emily was fantastic, Sean Johnson Front Desk Supervisor was terrific, Crystal at the front desk couldn't be more helpful, I could go on and on. This is a destination must for those who want a superior luxury experience.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome, I mean LA!!!”
Reviews.Author: Eiming
Reviews.Content: Fantastic room, amazing pool, top notch restaurants. Whoever is running the place seriously knows what they're doing. We had a seamlessly amazing time from the moment our car pulled in, to when we were waving goodbye when we left. Sorry, I'm not a big LA fan (yet) but my experience at the SLS just may turn me into one!!! I look forward to going back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Louise L
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at 6 am in the morning after catching an over night flight from Honolulu we where not sure if our room would be ready. I had even prepared a plea for a room so we could catch a few hours of sleep, but to our surprise we were greeted with 5 star service from the get-go. Within 10 min from arriving and given our car keys to the valet guy, we where in our room and our bags arrived within minutes. The design of this hotel is really something else and the rooms have all the right touches and features. The location is great and only a 2 min walk from the Beverly Center. The roof top pool is just something else with the art and mirrors surrounding it. We were only here for 1 night and had already made reservations at Katsuya in Hollywood so we only had a drink at Bazaar but boy they where some good drinks. Next time I'm in LA I'm definitely staying at the SLS again and I can highly recommend if you are in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Awake at 6:19 a.m.”
Reviews.Author: travelPAJ
Reviews.Content: I was awoken this morning shortly after 6 a.m. by a fire alarm. Clearly the alarm is intended to wake you up, so it is not gentle, it literally jolts you out of bed. Being on the top floor I was apprehensive, is it real? Is it a false alarm? I tried phoning downstairs to no avail. Got dressed and ran out only to be told in the hall to go back to bed, false alarm. Now these things happen, they are after all for everyone's safety, however when I called the lobby to ask what the cause was, I was told it was unknown. I asked if this has happened recently but the answer was "we are not allowed to disclose." Understood, so I asked to speak to the manager. Hold, hold, hold. Gave up. Called again a few minutes later as at this point the headache prevented me from sleeping. I was told manager would be right with me which really meant hold so long that I again thought of hanging up; this time i didn't. I expressed my concern for safety and asked what had really occured only to be vaguely told it was a 'false alarm,' I asked when was the last time this happened and the manager replied he did not know. When I pressed, I was then told 'well I have only been here a short while so that is why I don't know." I asked the manager who would know, he replied the operations manager; I asked him to please find out and get back to me as he seemed rather uncooperative regarding what I considered to be a safety concern, he replied he would. He never did. No one did. I called the fire department to ask about safety issues at the hotel. First thing I learned was that this hotel, in spite of the name and all its marketing, is not in Beverly Hills but in Los Angeles, so I was redirected to the Los Angeles fire department. The local inspector told me that in fact there had been 'quite a few incidents' in this hotel but they were mostly attributed to incorrectly placed sensors in the kitchen, the inspector was under the impression the hotel had resolved this but he would follow up. Since management never gave me a response i asked a member of the cleaning crew, he told me that this happens often and always at the worst time, he said, 'it recently happened at 3 a.m." I am shocked that management completely ignored my request for info and never replied. It is clear that the "I don't know answer" really means "I don't want to answer" as in the truth is not pretty. I will be cutting my stay short here. While most fault this hotel on lighting, which really is terrible, or staff attitude, which has room for serious improvement; or the gym, which is tired and dated and has no shower, steam or locker facilities unless you pay to use the spa, my main concern is one of safety and given the lack of reply I caution others.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience”
Reviews.Author: D Q
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at the SLS I realized that I had actually not "confirmed" my reservation. Given it was the 28th of December and near NYE I was in grave risk of not having a place to stay after traveling all day to get to the hotel. 100% my fault for not securing the reservation. But the hotel manager was incredibly helpful and amazingly accommodating. Because of how calm and focused he was at listening to my situation it also put me at ease while he and the front desk staff worked to find a solution. Once the room situation was addressed my nephew and I proceeded to have a remarkable time at the SLS Hotel. The rooms were amazing, rooftop pool is to die for and the food within the hotel itself is second to none. I typically hate letting people touch or valet my cars. But the valet guys at the SLS are actually pretty darn cool. Many of them are long time employees and seemingly remember faces quite well as they equally attentive to services as the core staff. The core hotel staff is distant but high attentive. I love the SLS and view it as a destination location.

Reviews.Title: “Be wowed”
Reviews.Author: CCbostonma
Reviews.Content: From the dark entryway, to the usually friendly check in staff - this is like a luxury W feel I've stayed here a bunch - as a Platinum starwood member. So the rooms have varied from a massive two room suite, to some that have an outdoor balcony area to enjoy some LA warmth. One consistent style approach I don't get is that the desk is behind the bed and usually the space between the wall and chair is tight making it feel like a cramped work area. The shower is walk in huge - though you'll get a shot of cold water as you need to reach under the shower to turn on the water. And of course - the Bazaar. Just count on being seated 30 minutes after your reservation time and enjoy the dazzle of Andres. Or go to Saam if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Front Desk Staff”
Reviews.Author: profiteroles21
Reviews.Content: I made several quick calls to SLS Hotel FRONT DESK Friday morning, and was fortunate enough to have my calls taken by LISA. If I were basing my decision to stay @this property on telephone interaction, I would have done so because of her...she is front desk professionalism personified...she answered my questions, made suggestions, & informed me of upgrade options. She is everything a guest would expect to find at a top hotel, but sadly rarely does ...Also sending kudos to Narita(?) who was the hotel operator...very pleasant as well, & spoke in a clear & precise manner. Well done SLS!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York City -- Greatest City in the World
Reviews.Title: “Creative design; cool rooms; hip crowd; a bit far from Bev Hills”
Reviews.Author: talent_guy
Reviews.Content: If you like design, this is a very interesting hotel. Starck's design flair makes the rooms and the public areas entertaining yet still comfortable. The Andres designed menus are creative with non-weird twists on Med cooking. Rooms are different and if you like 150-watt bulbs this is not the right hotel for you. Lots of smoked mirrors and dim lighting even in the bathroom gives rooms a nightclub feel. They do have fun twists like an all in one gym in my last room. It can be loud with some very large parties held there. The crowd is definitely upscale with partying first on many lists. As I left one morning at 4am a Maybach pulled up and two beautiful couples staggered out, their night just ending. Overall a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoNative29
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from 2/26 through 2/29 for my company's conference and can't say enough about the experience. I was greeted by one of the kindest front desk people I've met and he even signed me up for the Starwood program which was something I had planned on doing but didn't have time prior to the trip. My room was extremely spacious with all the comforts I could have hoped for. I didn't find dim lighting to be an issue, so perhaps this is a result of the hotel making this improvement after prior reviews. The FOOD WAS INCREDIBLE! As were the cocktails and I highly recommend getting a gin and tonic at the bar. Best I've ever had. I loved the whimsy of this place and the service throughout my stay was fantastic. Also, everyone at the conference commented on how luxurious the beds were. It was tough to get out of it in the morning. I highly recommend staying at this hotel for a truly unique experience.

Reviews.Title: “Quite the hotel”
Reviews.Author: tgropp
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on Feb 19-20 after our cruise. We used th SPG option, using 4800 points and $90.00. It was money well spent. The hotel is ultra modern and the service was amazing. The outdoor lobby was so quaint and the upstairs pool area with the private cabannas was great. The location was ideal. Definetly will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Not just another pretty face”
Reviews.Author: ShiraP
Reviews.Content: This is a gorgeous property with service to match! I enjoyed a birthday visit to SLS last week and I was bowled over by the stunning decor, luxurious touches, and sincere professionalism of the staff. Definitely splurge-worthy!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Wes G
Reviews.Content: 5 star service, pool, restaurants,.... Everything! Treated like you should at a 5 star. Close to sunset, stayed there for the music fest. Would recommend to anyone who has the $ to do it.

Reviews.Title: “Caught in the middle of trying to be hip and absurd”
Reviews.Author: BobbyG_ATX
Reviews.Content: There is a lot to love about this hotel and perhaps equally as much to hate. There is a cool factor baked into much of what they are doing. But it almost always goes to the point if cool for cool sake but not at all functional, practical or comfortable. I staid in a Studio suite. There was plenty of room but the room was dark and only had a smallish window. It looked very little like the bright, sunny and spacious room that was shown on their website. I definitely felt like I got a bait-and-switch. The room was extremely quiet though. The window was grimy and wasn't floor to ceiling as the website picture showed. The room is loaded with dark mirrors which gives you a sense that someone is always watching you through two way glass. I found it very unnerving. And there isn't a single place in the hotel to actually see yourself clearly. It is a but maddening and I'm not even female! I get te definite sense that the interior designer had absolutely no consideration for function or comfort when designing the SLS. A word of caution about the Internet. The SLS is the only hotel that I have ever staid at that charges BY DEVICE attached and not per room. I chened out and had three charge per night for Internet because I had connected my phone, iPad an computer. It is inexcusable tha Starwood allows this sort of policy at one of their hotels. Are they stuck in the 90's??! Also their app tells you that if you Like the SLS on Facebook that they will give you one day if free Internet access. Beware, they don't have a process in place for this and they I'd not comp mine. Overall I would not stay here again. It isn't as plastic as The W but it just lacks in way too many areas.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant AND comfortable”
Reviews.Author: melinda311
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel! i didn't actually stay in the hotel (but the rooms are fantastic and I will absolutely put visiting clients into this hotel). A number of my colleagues and I now use this as a place to meet convivially with colleagues or out of town friends and business associates. The staff could not possibly have been nicer. There are numerous areas to meet - one with cozy couches and fireplaces, another in a high tech section, another with private cushy comfortable chairs and couches - and everywhere electric outlets to plug in ones computers. There are both wonderful tasty snacks and divine food. And the food service director is this amazing woman, French i believe, who could even talk to us about wines and history and Europe. A delight! It's in Beverly Hills yet a few blocks away from the mad traffic. A veritable friendly elegant oasis in the midst of a busy city. Love it!

Reviews.Title: “Happening Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RemyBoy
Reviews.Content: SLS...a very hip happening hotel. The restaurant is Jose Andres The Bazaar, very hip place. Our hotel room was very comfortable. Good location in the Miracle Mile area, near Beverly Center (nice shopping mall), 3rd Street (boutique shopping and good restaurants) and lots of restaurants on La Cienega. The Cons...Far from LAX. They do charge for internet unless you are a platinum SPG member. They also charged $35 a day to park your car which you have not choice since street parking is by permit. My husband did complain about the bath towels, he thought they were flimsy.

Reviews.Title: “Really Liked It!”
Reviews.Author: islascaribe
Reviews.Content: I did read many of the reviews, so I was prepared for dim lighting and dust, etc. but really, all in all, the SLS rooms (we had 2) were spotless and the lighting was fine. Maybe the lighting had been changed recently as the manager's response in prior reviews indicated, I don't know. We opened the curtains and the lighting was fine for our purposes (computer, reading, etc.). The standout here is the staff! Seriously, we have never had such lovely and wonderful staff at any hotel anywhere. We were only there for 2 days, but each time we came in, we were greeted as if we were friends and warmly welcomed back by more than one staff person. I would like to mention several staff members that went above and beyond...from Tres Restaurant, there was Mallory, Lacey, Lauren and Rachel. I did partake of the great free coffee in the mornings and was pleasantly surprised to learn that I could take box of the buffet breakfast up to our room, which was super convenient. The staff was happy to get the box and pack up some awesome Greek yogurt for my kids (yes, I had kids there...they loved it). At the front desk, Aaron was just so sweet and friendly and helpful and Bobby the bellman was super at showing us around for our first time in the hotel. The best example of employee awesomeness had to be Gerald...who, when I asked for a trash bin for our almost finished Frappuccinos, smiled and warmly took them from me, gross napkins and all, took them from me. He could not have been nicer about it and I was not expecting THAT kind of service. The apples in the lobby were also a great touch and we loved them! The only problem that we had was an issue with the AC in RM 323. I did report it and they did work on it several times, but it was not a huge deal, since we simply opened the window to get cool air. I loved the full size shampoos and lotions...that's a great touch. We will be back, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Romance and Luxury at the SLS”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer B
Reviews.Content: Birthday special occasion was perfected by the awesome staff at the SLS Beverly Hills. SAAM and The Baazar by Jose Andres made this a memorable and inspiring experience

Reviews.Title: “Spent two weeks there and yes the best place in LA”
Reviews.Author: DaveKapolei_Hawaii
Reviews.Content: In my last review i refered to the hotel as a W for adults and while true it is so much more. The best food and i have to say some of the best staff i have ever encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Glum and Glummer”
Reviews.Author: RaiMondo27
Reviews.Content: The property's fine location, stellar restaurant fare, and cheerful employees are at variance with the hotel's dreary sleep quarters. How bitterly they disappoint, with dismal corridors and morgue-like rooms. It would seem to be a hotel prepared for a celebrity death, but honestly, what celebrity would be caught dead staying there? Starwood guests may be dismayed to find that this Starck exercise in rich materials and poor functionality has somehow gotten itself onto the Luxury Collection list. If none of this dissuades you, or if you've had such a fine night at The Bazaar that you decide to stay over, remember to be nice to the hotel employees. They work in a soulless building, yet still manage to serve guests with warmth and humanity. It can't be easy.

Reviews.Title: “Sexy, fun hotel.”
Reviews.Author: sf2world
Reviews.Content: A unique SPG property. This was my 2nd stay. The differences and outlandish touches are what makes this place fun. Great people watching. Not a place for families or business travel. A great hotel for a weekend getaway. I love the room decor (not my personal style but that's part of the appeal) and especially the well-appointed bath. The mirrors everywhere are what make the place. If this is not your thing, go to a Westin. Really good valet service; certainly helps justify the price. I have to give hotel "average" for service overall due to poor staffing and lack of attentiveness at pool deck on weekend as well as lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Like Staying In a Dark Hall of Mirrors”
Reviews.Author: hurricane8879
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the SLS Beverly Hills and find it to be like staying in a dark hall of mirrors, similar to a horror ride at an amusement park. It is definitely trying to be more of a "hip" hotel geared towards a more a Hollywood crowd, but comes across cheesy, worn, and dated and not luxury at all. It's California - let some natural light in thru the windows and feel the California vibe! (Mondrian is hip and still has natural light!) I have turned every possible light on in my room, in addition to opening the curtain, and it is still dark in here. When a light was out in my bathroom yesterday, I didn't even notice because it is that dark in here. Not helping was the family in the room next door that was up at 6am every day playing loudly with their children. Which is actually quite contrary, since this place is the opposite of family friendly. It's a little bit tricky to complain about family noise at 6am (as opposed to music at 3am), but it was disturbing nonetheless and should at least underscore how thin the walls are here. Coming off 3 nights at Terranea, this hotel is quite a letdown. But I had to stay Starwood and use points, so I figured this would be the best option.

Reviews.Title: “the gym (so-so), room amenities (misleading) and staff training (superb)”
Reviews.Author: superdeluxe
Reviews.Content: I am sticking to the gym, the room amenities and staff training for my review, to not repeat others' raves. Overall a very good hotel, loved the location in particular. The gym: is fairly large and has some unusual features such as leather sofas and some equipment that no one seems to use - several of the cross-trainers and treadmills were out of order when I was there so there was a line of people waiting to do their morning cardio each day - this is one aspect they should improve. It is LA and we had a lot of tacos to burn off. The room amenities: as others have mentioned, the full sized bath gels etc. are cool and then there are all these small items that appear to be offered for your use but they are not. There was definitely no indication that they were for sale until our last day when a price list appeared. I cringed! Oops, too late. I had used the $46 moisturizer and did wonder why it had not been replenished. I think it happens a lot that the price list is not evident, so beware. My best impression, really, was not the dazzle of the Philippe Starckness of the rooms or the molecularness of the gastronomy but how well run the hotel is and how polished and well trained the staff is. This is a rare thing to be impressed by: the staff was in every respect incredibly well-spoken, courteous and warm (and not phony), every request was handled promptly (they do not provide robes and slippers in the rooms but you get them in about 60 seconds when you ask), and they were very well aware of who was in the hotel and where they were at all times, which means you can expect discretion and security and we like that.

Reviews.Title: “Not what they think they are!”
Reviews.Author: mdsd2012
Reviews.Content: We recently attended an event and stayed overnight. While the staff was competent, friendly and helpful, the hotel seems 'tired" the carpeted entry needs to be replaced, the "dark tone walls and carpet are soiled and mismatched where they tried to patch it. The guest rooms were VERY DARK, and not user-friendly. Light switches are well hidden, some lamps were not even plugged in, the plumbing leaked to the point of having us put towels down. When reported, the front desk response was "oh yeah-- that happens all the time". VIP/Celebrities at our event commented that they would never stay there-- just attend an event. The dining service is very slow, yet the meal was quite good. Too bad. The banquet area and staff was top notch. Lesson learned from the pros-- "attend and event, but don't stay there".

Reviews.Title: “Pear Recovery Retreat at SLS”
Reviews.Author: PlasticDan
Reviews.Content: Was referred to Recover after surgery at Pearl Recovery Retreat at luxurious and trendy SLS hotel. Was booked at their suite after discussed my stay with Isabella, owner of that recovery. It was my first time in LA and that location did give me chance to be right in the center if the city, close to all shopping and entertainment . Service of both SLS and Pearl Recovery Retreay were excellent . Will be back soon!!! Danielle

Reviews.Title: “Ballin' on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: Hannah Y
Reviews.Content: So I stayed here for two nights. The first night was great, the room was equipped with ipod speakers, the TV appeared from the mirrored wall, the bathroom was stocked with FULL-SIZED shampoo, conditioner, body wash, face wash, hand wash, hand soap, etc. etc. and also lot of fancy spa items that looked free but then you find the little tent that informs you that if you take home the bathsalts it will cost you at least $30. LOL So don't ransack the bathroom without checking the prices first. First complaint is the lack of bathrobes, or at least my room did not have one. The second one we moved to the second night also did not have them so maybe it was just our bad luck. Also we tried cracking the window and both days and nights found the courtyard to be too loud and dingy to enjoy an open window. There was also some odd quirks like the second room did not have ipod speakers (we asked for them and they were promptly brought up) and the sliding door between the bathroom and the main room was like not properly sliding in our second room, and the hotel in general is just very dark and like hard to find bathrooms and such. But all that aside it was a very nice hotel, and even though we felt like window opening to the ugly courtyard was pretty budget--the rest of the decor was very nice and Phillipe Starck'd out to the max. I'd go back but only once I had enough Starwood points, might actually opt forthe Andaz instead. Much nicer roofdeck.

Reviews.Title: “Plush budoir!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ing33
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the SLS in Nov with my sister and really enjoyed it. Hotels can sometimes come down to personal taste and preference and this was definitely ours. You can tell when you walk in the decor is very cool and sumptuous and the bedrooms continued the theme. Cushions, curtains, decor, all very comfortable and plush. The concierge told us about the perks - car service, clothes pressing etc, but it was part of a conversation and slight afterthought, I think I would make these a bit more upfront. The TV is amazing, appeared on a big mirrored wall - a bit OTT but that's what I like about it. The only slightly downside is that while the bathroom looks gorgeous with a bath the shape of an egg, it's a little tricky to climb into - not a big deal though. I would definitely recommend this hotel and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Too cool for us!”
Reviews.Author: australiantripper_10
Reviews.Content: We spent a couple of nights at the very glam SLS in December; my husband and I and our 10 and 13 year old. Staff were all great and very helpful but this is place is for the 20-30 jet set crowd! Rooms are very small, very dark and cluttered with way too cool and too many objects de art. Bathrooms have no ventilation and the shower curtain over the waist deep bath tub was totally ineffective. In fact, so much so that the ceiling in the bathroom was starting to come away - not a good look for a top rated hotel. Good location next to Beverly Centre but there really isn't a central location in LA and invariably, you get a car or use car services anyway? The attached restaurant, Bazaar was brilliant though. Sorry but we won't be back

Reviews.Title: “Honeymooners only hotel”
Reviews.Author: Malaryan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, and luxurious. From a personal point of view, i would highly recommend the hotel for clubs and honeymooners (the hotel is very calm, cozy, and kinda romantic).

Reviews.Title: “I must say I was treated very well”
Reviews.Author: tijotijo
Reviews.Content: I stayed there just one night, As an spg Platinum wre were upgraded to a very nice Suite. I understand a few folks mentionned the lighting issues. But for me my goals for a good stay in an Hotel are location, updated and clean rooms and customer service and they all were ecellent..

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Treatment by Housekeeping :)”
Reviews.Author: Renu B
Reviews.Content: I suffer from a severe allergy to scents/chemicals. A few days before arriving at the SLS Beverly Hills, I contacted the head of housekeeping via email, Daniela Hiles. She responded promptly and advise me they would be extra mindful of preparing my room without scents/chemicals. She even said she'd prepare my room a few days in advance and open the windows in order to have it aired out for my arrival! To top it off, she tried to upgrade my room free of charge (which unfortunately didn't happen due to high occupancy). My stay was completely scent-free, which never happens at high-end boutique hotels. Daniela and her team went way beyond the call of duty to make sure my experience was the best for my health. Thank you so much! The room was clean, comfortable and beautiful. I'll definitely stay there every time I'm in LA.

Reviews.Title: “"The" Hotel to stay at when you are in LA!”
Reviews.Author: Judi0694
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying at the SLS Hotel at Beverly Hills this past November. This property is absolutely beautiful. It is the perfect combination of elegance and chic. The rooms are appointed perfectly, bath products are wonderful, the pool area is totally hip as are the other common areas including the state of the art fitness center. While staying there you must dine at Bazaar! You will love this unique dining experience! I was not able to use the spa but it looked like it was first rate! Judi Griffiths

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and Beyond.”
Reviews.Author: CESMPT
Reviews.Content: Words can simply not describe the fantastic experience I had at the SLS last weekend. From check in to check out each and every team member went over and above all of my expectations. Attention was paid to every detail including the room, lobby and restaurant. I would highly recommend a few nights at this extraordinary hotel. A special thanks to Aaron at the front desk and Brian at valet/bellhop. You both are a true asset to the SLS.

Reviews.Title: “Meh...”
Reviews.Author: JamesSheppard
Reviews.Content: There's no denying that this is a hip property. It seems that they've put about 90% of their brainpower into making it visually interesting and, let's face it, hip. Too bad they couldn't think about function with equal weight against form. The reviews that describe it as "dark and depressing" are certainly correct. Lighting is a problem. I couldn't even figure out how to read in bed. There are lots of visual bells and whistles but they don't make sound like bells and whistles should. They just sit there suggesting, "look at me. I'm a pretty bell or whistle". Specific issues: - it's crazy expensive. I wouldn't have issue with this except for the fact that crazy expensive should translate into a good experience. - minor maintenance issues like a TV remote that doesn't work and a shower door handle loose. Lame for this category of hotel. - Did I mention it's dark and I can't figure out how to turn on the various sculptural lamps? - Location is fine if you have a car, I suppose. I cabbed it, thinking I'd be near the Beverly Hills shopping area. I was wrong. There's nowhere to walk to. At least that I could see. - Mirrors everywhere. I'm not a movie star. I don't want to see myself out of every corner glance. I will say that the service was very good, the bed very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay in a stylish and trendy locale!!”
Reviews.Author: Western_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Our group (grandparents, parents, infant grand-daughter) had a very nice multi-generational family stay here between Christmas and New Year's. We are all seasoned sophisticated travellers, always up for new experiences; but also appreciative of friendly and unpretentious service. We all found our stay at the SLS to be a very enjoyable and unique experience. The decor and ambience throughout the hotel is ultra-cool and trendy, and so was a lot of fun to experience. Staff in the hotel and associated restaurants were all friendly, welcoming, helpful; and there was no "attitude". We had an outstanding dinner at the attached restaurant Bazaar - expensive but great fun. As part of the dining experience be sure to check out the museum-like display area, and the trendy washrooms.We also had a great breakfast in Tres, the lobby restaurant. As part of your SLS experience you should splurge in both Bazaar and Tres at least once. The complimentary coffee at the self serve station in the lobby was a nice touch, as were the complimentary newspapers and trays of apples throughout. We also enjoyed a dip in the stylish roof-top pool, and there is a very well-equipped fitness center. Parking (valet only) is efficient but a little pricey at $35, and all business center services are for a fee (except for printing boarding passes). Internet access is $13/day from anywhere in hotel. (there is NOT free internet access in the business center, contrary to what is stated on the hotel web site. I confirmed with front desk.) The huge Beverly Center shopping mall is only a couple of blocks away.We had an excellent inexpensive self-serve breakfast at the Corner Bakery Cafe on La Cienega just across from the mall. The cafe has a large menu, and is much larger inside than it looks from the street. The Grand Lux Cafe across the street from the Bakery Cafe looks like another good choice. Don't leave the area without having driven iconic Mulholland Drive, and having taken in the views from some of the outlook pulloffs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: vak_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip and had a wonderful stay. The location is great - walking distance to interesting shops and restaurants. The room was beautiful. The staff were very friendly and the concierge always gave me good recommendations for local outings. The pool/lounge area looked gorgeous - but it was a little chilly to experience it during my trip. I would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: tshissler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I loved almost all aspects of the hotel and would look forward to staying here again. We loved the room and the service was top notch. We also really liked the pool area. The staff really seemed to make an effort to take care of the guests. It was also a very good location for many of the things that we wanted to do. On the other hand, the food and drink were good, but a total rip off. It was way overpriced for what you received. I margarita in a small plastic cup by the pool was $20. I was also not very impressed with the size of the suites.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent service and location”
Reviews.Author: TravellingMonkeyUK
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, you cant go wrong. My first time in LA, they gave lots of info on how to get around, and they are in a good location. Beds / rooms are very comfortable and clean, restaurant is nice, and I noticed this hotel appears on the latest series of Entourage so it must be good! But this is all only the start....i left my keys and $1000 in the safe of the hotel and came back to the UK devastated. I contacted the hotel and they managed to send me everything. The money was there in full so I can only THANK their security teams, receptionists and night staff, and office staff who went out of their way to put the money in to my account, incurring charges themselves. EXCELLENT SERVICE - remember its only when things go wrong do you know how good a hotel is. Only feedback would be that the walls are a little thin...

Reviews.Title: “Creative Architecture & Elegant Ambience”
Reviews.Author: peter_vpnet
Reviews.Content: This is my third time staying here & still really enjoy the atmosphere & ambiance. Unfortunately, I was a little disappointed this time with my stay. I booked two rooms & my second room was not ready until almost 5:00pm. I was lucky enough that a new front desk person that was able to release a room from a VIP guest who was not expected in until late. I got to my room and called for room service for a blow dryer in which I waited 45 minutes for. After a poor start, things did get better. To sum things up: 1. Great property & atmosphere 2. Not very SPG friendly (don't expect an upgrade even at Platinum) 3. Room service will take a long time 4. Must be VIP to get excellent service 5. Well equipped fitness room 6. Bazaar bar & restaurant excellent 7. Nice roof pool

Reviews.Title: “Unpretentious luxury and sophistication”
Reviews.Author: Jminca
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved our stay at the SLS. My own bed at home is a high end incredibly comfortable bed and yet I slept like a baby. (I NEVER sleep well at a hotel. ) The service was top notch yet low key and welcoming. The room was well decorated and inviting, as was the large private terrace (worth it). The same magic that general manager Thomas Meding brought to the Parker Palms Springs has followed him to the SLS.

Reviews.Title: “Your personal safety is at risk at the SLS Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mercedes27
Reviews.Content: I am a well seasoned traveller who normally stays at 5 star hotels such as the Four Seasons in most major cities. I made the mistake on a recent visit to Los Angeles of staying at the SLS Hotel for about 4 nights. My expectation in a rated luxury hotel is that my room will be safe for me personally and that any belongings I have in the room will be safe. Not so at the SLS. We had purchased some clothing at Barney's and left it in the shopping bag in the room. Upon check out we noticed that the bag had vanished. That's when the so called Luxury Hotel showed it's true colours. I immediately called security about the missing bag and a security person came to the room and wrote a report. As we were in the process of checking out I was told I would hear back from the security officer within a few hours. Upon check out I asked for the General Manager as I wanted to make sure he knew of the incident. As he was not available I made sure the front desk was aware of the situation and asked that a message be left for him to call me. About 4 hours later after not receiving a call back as promised from the security person I called the hotel only to find he was not available but would return my call. This back and forth went on for about 6 weeks with no results of their investigation. I had also talked to Sarah the General Manager's assistant a number of times and asked her to have the General Manager call me but to no avail. I never recieved a call from the General Manager. Eventually after leaving several messages for their lead investigations person he did call and tell me that the results of their investigation had turned up nothing and of course they would not be reimbursing me anything as it was my word against their word. There were suggestions made by this individual that there were perhaps other ways they could look after me and he would get back to me on that but I never heard anything further. In all my years of travelling I have never had a worse experience than this hotel delivered to me. It's been 3 months since the loss occurred and all I have is further long distance telephone bills trying to get answers from these totally incompetent people. If safety and service is important to you do not stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “its like living in a b-grade celebrities head”
Reviews.Author: iloveaixMelbourne
Reviews.Content: its a very dark hotel. more like a nightclub vibe. the rooms after 5 nights started to become depressing in their darkness and dimness. having said that...everything else was faultless.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like Hollywood Royalty! The Only Place to in LA”
Reviews.Author: 5kings
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in less than three months at the SLS Beverly Hills. I point this out because my wife and I are people that love different hotel experiences and rarely stay at the same hotel. We've stayed at the Beverly Hills Hotel, L'Hermitage, Four Seasons but after that first stay at the SLS, we couldn't wait to go back. So much so that I had won a weekend stay at another luxury hotel and I choose to PAY to stay at the SLS again. From the moment you arrive,you feel like a movie star. The hotel staff is one of the best I encountered. Whether it was the valet or the housekeeping staff, everyone treats you like you are their primary concern. It is truly a level of service that you read about in travel magazines but rarely get to experience. The restaurants and room service are all run by Jose Andres, an innovative chef who's The Bazaar at the hotel is one of the hottest tables in LA. All of our meals at the hotels were unbelievable and again the staff were some of the most accommodating and courteous we've encountered. Be sure to have breakfast at Tres and have the French toast(like s bread pudding). At night, have a drink at the bar next to The Bazaar and order the Jose Andres Gin and Tonic or a Margarita with salt air foam. Keep your eyes peeled for celebrities as they flock here. After you check in, you'll enter an elevator with "other guests" muraled on the walls upon exiting your floor, you'll see a pool table with the words "Satan Loves Sinners" stitched on the side. There's an electronic painting of a victorian era man than slowly changes into a monkey. Your room is as funky as the rest of the hotel. Amazing beds, modern decor, and a tv hidden within a mirror. The roof top bar looks like something out of a movie set with a beautiful and attentive staff to match. The gym and spa leave nothing to be desired. You literally forget you are in one of the most congested parts of Los Angeles within the walls of the SLS. They also offer a chauffeured car for short trips. You can't help but feel like one of the Hollywood elite when you stay here. And you should because all the SLS staff treats you like one! Take my word and stay here on your next trip to Los Angeles. My hat is off to the General Manager of the hotel who not only directs this fine staff but heard about a special event we were celebrating and made our stay extra special. Keep up the amazing work! We'll be seeing you again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Good, let down by dark room and mediocre service”
Reviews.Author: superstardj
Reviews.Content: On paper, the SLS *should* be my top hotel in LA. It's well located, it's Starwood (as I try and stay in Starwood hotels wherever possible), trendy, and has some great restaurants both in the local vicinity and attached to the hotel, including Mortons, which is decent, and The Bazaar by Jose Andres which is supposed to be stunning but I'm yet to try. The rooms are very well designed, the gym's 24 hour, the room service menu is solid... so why I am complaining? Firstly, the rooms are very, very, very dark - the extent that seeing the contents of your suitcase is difficult, even with all the lights on maximum, and good luck getting ready, because even the bathroom's don't contain any bright lights at all. Which I understand is cool and relaxing and trendy etc, but a total nightmare if you want to style your hair - or for females - apply makeup. I was constantly seeing myself in the hall mirrors upon leaving my room and being horrified. But I guess my issue is with the service - it never seemed to be quite up to par for a hotel of this standard. Check in was downright unfriendly. I don't expect to have the red-carpet rolled out (although as a Platinum SPG member, it often is), but some basic politeness would sure be nice. As part of the benefits of SPG Platinum, you receive guaranteed upgrades to the best rooms available - and whilst that doesn't always happen, you're generally told "Sorry Sir, we're actually fully booked, so although you're a Platinum member we won't be able to improve your room, but will being whatever we can to make your stay great". I wasn't told anything, but when I asked if any better rooms were available, I was simply told "No". Long story but the short answer is, don't come here expecting any superior treatment for spending a huge amount of money with Starwood each year - you won't get it. As it happens, I had booked a suite anyway so the lack of a huge upgrade wasn't a huge issue, but as a top-level member of the hotel chain's loyalty scheme staying in a $400 suite booked with cash (not SPG points or anything), I would have expected a slightly better attitude. That sort of experience seemed to be a running theme throughout my four nights. For every helpful, ready-to-serve individual you'd encounter, they'd be another who let the whole place down. I called down at 11pm to try and arrange a laundry collection and was flatly told "The laundry opens at 9am Sir". "But can't you come and get my laundry now, for the morning?" I asked, as tends to be the procedure in any decent hotel, and was told again "Sir, the laundry opens at 9am". After calling back, frankly bewildered and asking to speak to a supervisor, I was told "Oh, I didn't understand what you meant. I'll send a bell-hop now". Er, yeah. I could go on, but I guess you get the drift. The concierge who seemed utterly unconcerned that I waited 15 minutes for a taxi when I was clearly bugged at running late for dinner. The fact that my mini-bar wasn't restocked once during a four day stay. The room-service chicken with mashed potato that came without mashed potato. It goes on. In short, it's good. It could be a lot better. Next time in LA, I'll be back staying at The London, which is a very similar sort of hotel and only about a mile away, but where they *do* get the service right. And when you're paying this much, they should.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Bubsche
Reviews.Content: Well, there is not much to say about this one. All you can expect from a beautiful hotel like this came true. Great service, outstanding food ( had the breakfast and was at The Bazaar ). Everybody is very friendly and I will come back for sure ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Place if restaruants & bars were open.....”
Reviews.Author: sbcbonds
Reviews.Content: In L.A. on biz and had to say this place had the"it" factor. It would have been a homerun, except the amenities you would expect for this price were not available(and we had 3 rooms). We came in from a great night on the Sunset Strip expecting to relax and have some great cocktails at the roof bar, but it was closed (really?) no reason given. We were already disappointed because we were set to eat at Bazaar and were told at the last minute it was closed for private party. That left the lobby bar, which had 1 bar, about 6 feet wide with people about 6 or 7 deep trying to get a drink. It was a zoo. For me, on this trip at least, SLS stood for So Little Service.

Reviews.Title: “chic but some downsides”
Reviews.Author: Earlham99
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the SLS while in town for my SIL's bridal shower. I liked the outdoor living room that they have set up on the front porch, but the interior is a bit weird. I don't know how to describe it - urbanist ecclectic or mish mash. I overheard one guest say that he had a giant picture of Sean Combs in this room. And I'm still not sure how I feel about the giant backlit glass deer trophies hung all over the 1st floor space. The restaurant is different than Baazar but Jose Andres is the executive chef. It is set up like a series of living rooms with seating at couches around coffeetables or small tables. I will give the service at the restaurant good marks. We had the same server 2 days in a row and he was very pleasant. And the food was great. absolutely the best yogurt that I have ever had! All the food was excellently prepared and presented. Unfortunately, Baazar was closed for a private event so we couldn't eat there. I would agree with other reviewers that the property is DARK. The lobby, the reception area, the elevator area, the guest rooms. DARK, DARK, DARK. I got an eyelash in my eye and it was really hard to see it because the bathroom was so poorly lit. Although the bathtub was cool (free standing with water coming out of the ceiling to fill it). I also didn't think the bed was that comfortable (I prefer the Heavenly bed at the Westin). The fitness room was well equipped. And it was the only place in the whole hotel that WASN'T dark! Overall I am giving the hotel good marks because of the quality of the service, the location and the vibe.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: chicagowl
Reviews.Content: Nothing but problems on my stay at the SLS! They messed up on my room reservation and it took them three hours to correct while I waited in the wrong room without any communication of what the problem was from the front desk. The rooms are so dark, the ironing board is so small you couldn't even iron a sock in it. The shower leaked all over the bathroom and the sliding glass door to the patio took mass might to open. I Called the conceriege for a club reservation and they said they were too busy and to call back. The pool attendant is a complete rag and puts reserved signs on all the chairs even though they never ended up being used that day. I give this hotel a 3 only because of its location, comfort, and design. If you like this location stay at the sofitel down the block or if you are looking for similar style and "scene" in a hotel stay at their other hotel The Redbury in Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Cool digs. Great service.”
Reviews.Author: ZZtravels51
Reviews.Content: I have been resisting staying here as I am not a fan of Sam Nazarian's sbe. Usually his restaurant/club establishments are just scenes with no substance with mediocre decor. Not the case at SLS. I have to be a fan of Sam now because he hired two visionaries to create an awesome experience: Phillipe Starck and Jose Andres. The design is fantastic. Interesting, comfortable, and whimsical. Very luxurious and a little pretentious (it's LA after all). Check in was easy and front desk was friendly and efficient. The room is really trippy. Bed is in the middle of the room, bathroom is all slate and tinted mirrored glass.Little trinkets all over the room (for you to purchase, of course). The room was EXTREMELY clean, which I was a bit surprised about due to the complexity of the room and the amount mirrored surfaces. My only criticism is that the bed could be a bit more comfortable. By no stretch of the imagination would I say it is uncomfortable, but considering how great the room was it was a little disappointing. Also the chaise lounge wasn't very comfortable. The lobby bar was well decorated, served terrific drinks, and had a good crowd. The pool area was a bit cluttered. They need to do a better job here due to the competition of Hollywood rooftop pools. I didn't eat in the restaurant this time around, but have in the past and it is delicious and fun. I did order room service however, which was delicious and prompt. I ordered it through the SLS mobile app which they advertise all over the place. This was a fun feature that I'm sure will catch on at other luxury properties. Allows you to pre-order room service (did it the night before, got a call 15 minutes before my order time just to confirm), request housekeeping, book restaurant and spa reservations, get your car from valet, among other things. If I was staying longer I definitely would have taken more advantage of this feature. Besides the firmness of the bed, this was definitely one of the best hotels I've stayed at on the West Coast. Plus them being a part of Luxury Collection means starwood points! Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Quick trip, great stay”
Reviews.Author: ben s
Reviews.Content: Just spent a night at the hotel but really enjoyed it. Beautifully designed and fantastic service. Plus, the Baazar restaurant at the hotel is one of the best in the entire country, hands down.

Reviews.Title: “SO CLEAN, I loved it!”
Reviews.Author: cutiepieM
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure if it was a good idea to have booked this hotel, since we were traveling with kids and I thought it maybe only for a crowd without kids who enjoy the Hollywood Nightlife. I am glad I was proven wrong. It is a great hotel. Very clean. Our room was spotless (and let me tell you I really felt bad for the housekeepers, whose job must be very tough---cleaning all the mirrors....). Our room was spotless! The bed was really comfy. The pool upstairs was great, and the guy working the bar was very nice and pleasant. Also, the Valet guys did a great job. Why did I take off one point? I wish you could open the windows---I just like to have some fresh air, instead of using the AC... Oh I forgot to mention room-service. Prices are kind of high, but I still enjoyed the Guacamole Sandwich very much, and the kids loved their choices of the Kids Menu. I have to say, next time I come to LA, I want to stay in this hotel again! It's worth it!

Reviews.Title: “For Starwood Status maintainance only”
Reviews.Author: Justine W
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night on our way home to help maintain Starwood status. The property is relatively old and has been updated. The designer did not consider functionality in the update. There was minimal lighting in the room and bathroom making it hard to apply make up. We had to put suitcases under the few recessed lights in the room to see at all. There is no lighting to turn off at the bedside or reading lights. The bed is in the middle of the room with sharp corners on the frame--I banged my shin. The rooms still have the feel of an old hotel. The pool area is very nice and the lunch menu was good and tasty. The property is not very centrally located to the main shopping area of Beverly Hills but there is a complimentary drop off service and Danny the driver was very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location, and housekeeping did a great job.”
Reviews.Author: PlatinumJeffrey
Reviews.Content: Anniversary trip with my wife. Great stay. Many Benz's and better in the parking lot. Quite a bit of Beverly Hills attitude in the bar with posers trying to someone they're not. The hotel itself was great. Great location, very accommodating staff and good service. Rooms are pretty dark and need to be brightened up with better lighting. Wife says bathroom was definitely designed by a man. Great place. Daniela in housekeeping was top notch!

Reviews.Title: “Uber stylish hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BlueWarrior1
Reviews.Content: Was here on a 2 night stay with my wife. Had booked using SPG reward points, but still got upgraded to a king room with an open terrace. Everyone was very courteous and friendly - right from bell hop to concierge to telephone operators! Rather high parking fee, but I guess that's what you would pay for at any hotel in the area. Definitely one of the nicer SPG properties I've been to. Me and my wife loved our time here, and will probably choose to come back to this hotel on our next trip to LA!

Reviews.Title: “SWANKY”
Reviews.Author: DominicParamore
Reviews.Content: Was not disappointed by anything in particular, but at the same time was not overwhelmed by the staff nor the hotel itself. It was more gimmicky than comfortable, we had breakfast downstairs in front of our own fireplace, but the table and couch were very difficult to eat at comfortably. The location is great to take advantage of all the great shopping in the area, so that is one of the best assets of the hotel. We selected the hotel because we had reservations at the hotel restaurant, so not sure we would return again on another trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great service... Can't go wrong.”
Reviews.Author: claybrizendine
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the SLS on a Saturday night, moving there from another hotel, because it was closer to those things that I would be doing on that particular night. I used my Starwood points and booked a room there, not sure what I was getting myself into. When I left, I said that I'd never stay at another hotel in the LA area if I didn't have to. From a location standpoint, you can't go wrong. For those that have been to LA, you know how spread out it is, and if there were a 'central' location to a lot, this would be it. The hotel itself was magnificient. It was incredibly popular and packed with people, but still maintained a somewhat cozy feel. My room was incredibly appointed, with the highlight being the dark-mirrored wall with the TV directly in the center of it. The bathroom had a standing shower only and plenty of modern amenities. I appreciate that they had bottles of soap, shampoo, etc. that were large enough that you only used what you needed and that the hotel wasn't going to throw away an entire bottle of liquid just because I used a little bit. The fitness room was the best in any hotel I've stayed in. Two rooms big, one side maintained cardio equipment while the other had the circuit resistance machines. What set it over the top was that it had two, $10,000 each Kinesis machines from TechnoGym. These things are out of this world cool looking and work you out incredibly well. There was a really packed restaurant and bar on the 1st floor that I did not eat at, but given the popularity and star rating, I've heard it was good :) All in all, I would return in a second. My favorite hotel used to be the W San Francisco, but this one has replaced it. You will not go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Need to get better at blocking & tackling”
Reviews.Author: Chris K
Reviews.Content: SLS is certainly stylish but I found the lack of basic luxury hotel standards to be a serious detractor from the overall experience. 1. No doorman / generally unhelpful welcome at the door. You only get one chance at a good first impression and SLS whiffed here. Waited around for a valet, couldn't figure out which entrance to go to, and nobody was there to take our bags. 2. Rooms. Biggest issue: the beds are too small. I am 6'2, which is not enormous, and my feet were hanging off of them. Also didn't have an iPod player... really? 3. Bathroom. The worst part. They have a bunch of toiletries in the bathroom which I thought was a nice touch until I realized you had to PAY for them. How tacky. Second, the bathtub/shower combo is just bizarre- the shower head is in the ceiling and water splashes all over the floor outside the bathtub. Finally, they have that horrible hotel trend where the bathroom doors slide open to the room - as if anyone wants to look in or out the bathroom from the rest of the room. 4. In general the place seemed kind of dingy. Needs new carpets. The things they do well: 1) The rooftop pool is tight. 2) The bar drinks are good and the place is generally a scene. 3) The location is pretty good - not PRIME Beverly Hills but close enough.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and glamor that's sometimes over the top”
Reviews.Author: RegTravellers
Reviews.Content: True luxury hotel, with well appointed rooms, great service and beautiful design. Lobby restaurant, "The Bazaar by Jose Andres", is a total blast and highly recommended. Arrivals area can be a bit of a scene, and the use of the "SLS" acronym on everything from in-room dining options to laundry service bags gets old quickly. But, overall, if you're in the mood for it, SLS is lot of fun.

Reviews.Title: “SLS stands for slow luxury service.”
Reviews.Author: Luis90220
Reviews.Content: My first impression of the hotel staff was great. Everyone was very helpful and was truly there to give me great service. Until the next day when I ordered ice for my room right before I went out and I ended up waiting a whole hour just for them to bring it out to me. I had to call three times to check to see when it was going to arrive and they kept telling me 15 min and that someone was already on there way. Because of this it made my night less eventful since I wasted a whole hour just waiting on something that should be so simple to get. I can only imagine if I would've asked for more. Which I did when I arrived back from being out. I ordered in room dining from the kitchen. I ordered two WELL DONE cheeseburgers but instead got plain hamburgers and then not cooked thoroughly. It wasn't even cooked at all. It was undercooked and when I informed the kitchen they said we ordered hamburgers and were only sorry for them not being cooked. Yet still made me sign the bill for it. The only good thing is that the next day during check out I informed the front desk and they took care that issue for me. Which only meant they gave me awful food for free. Nothing else. I wouldn't Really recommend to anyone to order in room dinning service since they just don't seem to know what they're doing there.

Reviews.Title: “Great but the price is NOT right for what you get”
Reviews.Author: NewHampshirePeppie
Reviews.Content: I'll preface by saying this was my first luxury experience. I don't regret it. A ton of fun. HOWEVER, personally more comfortable in the "regular Sheratons" that give you lots of amenities without the frills. I was appalled at what I paid and how little I got. No paper at your door, no room coffee. Everything in room was extremely expensive. The pool is GORGEOUS. Cold though and very surprised no hot tub. Was freezing after my dip and off to the fitness center only to be told the steam room use was $30! This is after paying well over $300 for our room! The decor is very funky but not my style. Both my friend and I thought this was a very male place with hunting/man cave motif. The room wasn't really user friendly. Very dark with phallic long lights. Fun but not fun-ctional! The best part was the amazing tender loving care by Natasha both at the pool and the restaurant. She really pampered us and was just delightful. Also Danny who did the room orientation and made us feel right at home. It was a lifetime experience to stay in the heart of Beverly HIlls and experience the star treatment but not my cup of tea. We were there for Dancing with the Stars and it was a blast! The food is totally divine! Hadn't realized this is the top chef in the area and the flavors are magical. The chocolate molten cake with cardamom foam is still appearing in my dreams! MOST of the staff was above and beyond but so much surprised me. No door man and a big door to maneuver. Many don't acknowledge you or say hello. The concierge was great! Frido was so much fun and so good to us. The curbside desk staff woman was uninformed and not at all friendly. Really surprised me they had her as the first impression as it was NOT a good first impression but once you go inside to the concierge, you feel the reason this is a luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hip and differant”
Reviews.Author: fromsocal
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in an upper floor. It was not high enough though as we had a view of a parking lot. The hotel has that modern flair and it was nicely set up. The rooms are somewhat on the small side and I do have to agree with the darkness. Although it is kind of sexy and romantic lighting, it would be noice to have an option for brighter if needed, especially in the bathroom when getting ready to go out. The bed was very comfortable and the set up of room was well laid out. The wardrobe cabinet was nice as well. We had good service and enjoyed the rooftop pool for just relaxing by. It is a small and shallow pool, but it does its job. For the area, you do have to pay more for hotels, so I guess it was average.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated Lodging Situation”
Reviews.Author: billyar
Reviews.Content: There is nothing cookie cutter about the SLS. The hotel is high gloss modern with a nice sense of humor about itself. One has to appreciate any property where there is something new. Here mostly, clever design and details count. Plus it is built on an old-school foundation of good service. Marriott lovers beware: this is not the place for you. There is enough glass in the rooms to rival the Crystal Cathedral, and the color palette is cascading shades of gray with a bit of dark brown thrown in for excitement. I find the rooms quite minimal and relaxing. Video is hidden behind a wall of glass and another glass wall slides back to reveal the bath. All the usual high end amenities are at hand. The custom built furniture is unique and mostly successful. If one looks carefully some clever details reveal themselves. The lighting is on numerous dimmers and custom fixtures. Unfortunately the stlagtight-like fixtures over the table hang too low and are, literally, painfully awkward. In the deluxe room I would hit my head every time I stood up from the modern seating. In the Studio Suite it hung inches from my left shoulder when I sat at the elegant table. I think a brighter and friendlier fixture is in order.
