Reviews.Title: “Unique design, wonderful service, fun vibe, amazing restaurant”
Reviews.Author: MEMSPhD
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the SLS in as many months. As someone who is interested in design and fashion, I appreciate the unique style of the hotel. It's a feast for the eyes and the rooms are really beautiful and sexy. The restaurant and bar at the Bazaar cannnot be missed and the concierge was great about getting me in even though I didn't plan ahead enough to make a reservation (and it was packed, of course). Definitely a place to see / be seen. Service is everything you would expect from a 5 star hotel and more! I was contacted before my stay and the concierge made sure I had the perfect room. Candy from the in-hotel dessert kitchen was waiting in my room. They were always friendly and happy to tell me about the area. I didn't have any problems but I'm sure they would have taken care of them immediately. Hope to stay here again soon, would be fun for romantic weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Lux”
Reviews.Author: spikesmumSF
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really incredible. I've stayed at 5 star resorts all over the world and the SLS Beverly Hills rates right up there with them and then some. It's just so unique in every detail from the vibe to the decor to the amenities and especially The Bazaar which is hands down one of the best restaurants I've dined in. Everything about the SLS Beverly Hills is well thought out, the vision is very clear. I have to say the thing that impressed me the most was the email I got from guest relations before I arrived. It was a special weekend for me and my boyfriend and Aaron had champagne delivered to our room! He also followed up with me several times during our stay to make sure everything was going well. We had an amazing dinner Friday evening and got our butts kicked by Agostina's bootcamp on Saturday. The gym is not to be missed and you definately have to check out the pool. Who needs Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and fab service, hip and fun atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: bernandpaul
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay here before christmas in order to do some shopping at The Grove (nearby). The staff were top notch and the accommodations are luxurious and modern without being tragically hip! The very best thing about this hotel is the Bazzar restaurant which is phenomenal.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel delivers quality and excitement without being overstated”
Reviews.Author: fozzetti
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a fabulous stay at the SLS. The service was very attentive and prompt, without being over-bearing. The look of the hotel is very modern and hip, but again, not overdone. Our room was terrific, very spacious with huge bathroom and very comfortable bed. Stayed with Amex platinum and received room upgrade, free breakfast and $100 credit toward food/bev. The spa was sensational, excellent tub soak and couples massage. Avoid the version of this package where they give you a candle. Turns out to be a $60 candle. Went to the pool for while. Cool set up on the roof. The day turned out to be busier than the hotel might have expected, I think. This was the one part of the stay that was only good. Still it was good. Had dinner at Bazaar. This restaurant is not to be missed. The creative cuisine, the service and the wild cocktails made every moment memorable. The hotel goes out of it's way to follow up before and after your stay to ensure that everything was tremendous and does a nice job of it. Aaron Gonzales was particularly helpful for me.

Reviews.Title: “LA Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: NYCAndrew82
Reviews.Content: As an SPG Platinum with 42 stays last year, I can confidently say I've been all over the country with Starwood Preferred Guest. No hotel goes out of its way for Platinum Guests like the SLS in Beverly Hills. From consistent no hassle upgrades to pre-arrival emails to ensure things are just right to a VIP cabana at the rooftop pool equipped with complimentary drinks and water, the SLS knows how to treat frequent customers like they are true VIPs.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Lovely Stay-SLS”
Reviews.Author: dgcasting
Reviews.Content: The SLS is a cut above other high end hotels but it does so without having its nose up in the air like other 5 star hotels are prone to do. The SLS is contemporary, stylish...hot! but its staffed with people who truly care about your stay. It's the Staff that makes the difference. This was our 2nd stay at the SLS and there will be more. Note to those traveling with families; the SLS is not really for kids. They would have more fun elsewhere. But you and your spouse on your own? now you are talking!

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel is a dark disco”
Reviews.Author: kodySydney
Reviews.Content: Firstly the positives. The service at this hotel is fantastic expecially around the pool area. This hotel is aimed at cashed up young trendy set not for a middle aged couple like us. We arrived at 10pm to a red carpet dark noisy entrance. I actually thought I had arrived to a disco. Upon entering it was just as dark and walked up to reception. They gave me my room key. I went to sleep to be kept up all night by this very loud sounding jumbo jet noise. By 4am I rang downstairs and they sent up a maintence guy who said yes it is noisy we can change your room. I said maybe at 8am I will change rooms which I did. The noise apparantly was vents above that room. (this room was a Premier room not a standard room) I changed rooms after not sleeping all night. The rooms are also just as dark as the lobby. At check out they actually wanted me to pay extra for the change of rooms are you kidding they should have offered me some kind of compensation for my lack of sleep the first night. I have very mixed feelings about this hotel. As service is very good. It is certainly very different to anything I have ever stayed at but I doubt I will be back

Reviews.Title: “Super Luxurious Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tanner88
Reviews.Content: I thought that I would spoil myself for my birthday and it was worth every penny! The interior of the hotel is amazing and the service is fantastic. The concierge, Casey, deserves particular mention - he went out of his way to make the stay one to remember! A few bits of advice... Book a table at Bazaar for dinner when you check in. It's super busy and all those damn celebs make it tough to get a table late in the day. Breakfast at the hotel (Tres) is spectacular but a little overpriced. Eggs should be included in the buffet. They can't make a latte to save themselves but their granola and yoghurt was incredible. Service was A+. Overall this was a fantastic stay and well worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “The SLS is experience is fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: jwpatton385
Reviews.Content: When I stayed at the SLS in April of last year (2010) it was an experience that I have to say I will never forget. I stayed with a few friends for a night for my birthday. The staff was very kind and warming. The ambiance was amazing. We stayed in one of the suites which was very roomy and sexy. Aaron Gonzales was the person who helped us with our accommodations. He was very nice, full of energy and all smiles. He took us out to the pool which I have to say is one of the better pools in LA and also walked us over to Bizarre which was a very funky/beautiful restaurant. I am a big fan of most of SBEs venues and if I need to stay in the West LA area again, I will strongly consider the SLS hotel for accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hip hotel”
Reviews.Author: KateCinci
Reviews.Content: Great location in Beverly Hills. The hotel is hip - very fun decor and comfy/modern rooms. Bonus - the restaurant in the hotel called Bazaar is one of my all time favorites!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: socal_999
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 2 day getaway. Everything has been redone, so the rooms were very well appointed and clean. The service was the best. Every little thing was followed up on. We had a pleasant surprise in the Tres restaurant, a really, really lovely dinner. (The main restaurant was a little too much of a scene for us middle aged folks:). Very modern design - The most Moooi I have ever seen deployed in one location! All in all, a first rate experience. We generally stay at the London, but we will definitely be adding the SLS into the mix.

Reviews.Title: “stay to remember”
Reviews.Author: jkuhl
Reviews.Content: i stayed here with a friend for two nights in the end of december and could not have asked for anything more. The room was large,clean and well designed, the service was impeccable and the vibe was great! Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for solo traveller”
Reviews.Author: traceller
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel twice over the course of a monbth and on both occasions I had a great stay.Friendly staff and try the restaurant and bar by Jose Andres.Great place, great Gin Tonics and an even greater crowd.I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and service!”
Reviews.Author: teenytinytina
Reviews.Content: To celebrate my boyfriend's birthday, we did a one-night stay at the SLS in one of their lifestyle suites - their rooms with gym equipment. My boyfriend loved it! After I passed out from an amazing dinner at the Bazaar downstairs, he spent a couple of hours playing with the gym equipment. Aaron, a guest relations coordinator, contacted us prior to the trip to see if there's anything they could help rearrange for us. After a few email exchanges (amazingly fast responses), he set up our dinner reservation as well as a little treat for my boyfriend's birthday (chocolate covered strawberries + champagne). I would definitely stay here again for a fun night out! (Parking attendants were a little snooty though... we stood around for 3-4 minutes right in front of them before they acknowledged us.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location BUT......”
Reviews.Author: GoGirl07
Reviews.Content: The first thing about the hotel is that when you pull up, you are immediately told that parking will be charged to your account and it will cost $36.00 per night. The next thing is that when you walk up towards the lobby to check in, you have to pass through the smoking area/lounge. It was disgusting - ash trays and people puffing away. Also, one guest just flicked their cigarette over the railing when they were done. Not too classy. We stayed on the 2nd floor, and I was surprised at how dirty and stained the hallway carpets were. This is also the floor where the spa is located. One more thing. The beds were not at all comfortable. They were slat beds, similar to ones you would get from IKEA. The best thing about this hotel though is the location. Other than that, it is just average.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch service and impeccible standards; you must stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JoanneSanDiegp
Reviews.Content: I could not have been more satisfied. Every member of the staff anticipated my needs and made certain that I enjoyed my weekend to the extent that I would return as soon as possible. Attention to detail and extra amenities.... I could not have asked for anything more. My 23 year old daughter was traveling with me and she was equally delighted by the service tha we received.

Reviews.Title: “Great Glitz, Lousy Managment”
Reviews.Author: real_in_philly
Reviews.Content: My family, 3 couples, stayed at the SLS while attending a family wedding in Los Angeles. I do not recommend the hotel. The hotel did not make up my room or my daughters. I arrived back at the hotel at midnignt after the wedding and ended up making up my own bed so my husband and I could go to sleep. I got lots of appologies from the front desk at midnight and the following morning when we checked out - but in all my travels (and I do alot of traveling) NO hotel has ever not made up my room before. It was not a mistake, they did not do my daughter's either. SImple unexplained incomptence. Checkout (we checked out at different times) took 20 minutes. The hotel had not deducted for a 20% spa credit, and meal/beverage coupons. The front desk could not look at the details of each transaction so they had to call the spa and restaurant for details for all the transactions. Because it could not be figured out expeditiously, the manager gave us an additional $50 off the bill. We accepted the rebate as close enough, after all we had a plane to catch. Structurally, the hotel is very avant-guarde. The bathrooms have two "barn" doors. They are not very soundproof and you heard much more bathroom noise in the bedroom than you should. In addition, We could easily hear the two children in the room next to ours. Parking was extremely expensive. and they charge for internet, Basically, I will not stay here again. This is not a first class experience. Stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Bumpy Start - Smooth Finish”
Reviews.Author: VPVonHoehen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a Starck designed chic Beverley Hills hotel that comes with all the bells and whistles including two of the best restaurants in the city (there is also an excellent third one) and and a great social environment complete with heaps of celebrities (if that is what you are into - I can't recognize even the ones whose names I do know). My initial impression of this hotel was of style over substance. In fact, one week into my five week stay, I was looking for other digs in the Hills where I was more certain that service standards would match my own standards. After a few serious conversations with management I was given a personal "handler" Henry Marquis, and he, along with Waldo Hernadez, the head concierge, and Autumn, the manager of Tres and the Altitude level, and many many other staff pulled together and not only convinced me to remain at the hotel the rest of my stay in Los Angeles but they managed to make me not regret it. Rooms are still a bit style over substance, especially for a long term guest, but overall this could be on its way to be a very smart, hip, hotel with great service (if they keep it up). I will be back in January so I will be able to say then if the service matches the claims of SBE's own PR spin.

Reviews.Title: “Dark and Dirty”
Reviews.Author: ViaggioGirl
Reviews.Content: So the SLS has a popular restaurant. That's about the best I can say for this establishment. It's not a very clean place - expired mini bar food and the room felt like a 70's grotto. Full size toiletries - who used them before me? Is this a hostel or a hotel? Funky monkey photos and art. NOT my kind of hotel. If you are looking for comfort and luxury, this is NOT your place. Lots of other places in LA that meet those requirements.

Reviews.Title: “SLS is Luxury with a sincere focus on comfort and service.”
Reviews.Author: dalmy
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at SLS since the opening in 2009 and I have never been disappointed. During my business stays, I have everything I need and my leisure stays feel like a true escape. While there have been a few mishaps during my stays, they have more than made up for any inconvenience I experienced. The best part of my SLS experience is the concierge service. Waldo, Casey, Fredo and team have it down and are by far the best at their craft. If I had to pick one thing they could enhance, the lighting in the bathrooms would be top of my list. Also, I have enjoyed many meals at the Bazaar and I have never had a bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “before you reach reception you know you are somewhere different..”
Reviews.Author: neilsonparc
Reviews.Content: Passing through a small outdoor lounge with furniture made from, or heavily featuring, the horns of various animals and small tree branches you get to the lobby and youâ€™re greeted by a life-size black horse with a lamp-shade on its head, accompanied by a pig balancing a fruit platter. You know you're in Philippe Starck-world. SLS Hotel scores a Hot Pink on the neilsonparc Lust List.

Reviews.Title: “Hottest New Hotel in LA - Four Seasons quality with much hipper feel”
Reviews.Author: saulty1017
Reviews.Content: This is the best new hotel in LA. Very funky design in lobby and rooms, but all thoughtful and comfortable. The food at the restaurants is great - not your typical modern menu - its different and really tasty. Location in Beverly hills is excellent too. No reason to the Pennisula or four season - this is just as good, better rate and you will not feel like you are 65 years old.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with design and character”
Reviews.Author: ha_robert
Reviews.Content: we were upgraded to a suite. beautiful room. nice decor. enjoyed the gym also. pool is spectacular!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, just a few details”
Reviews.Author: charal95
Reviews.Content: Me and my two kids came for my son's birthday. I'm going to write the next review and my stay went. Check in/Check out So we arrived at this beautiful hotel through the Red Carpet. The check-in wan't what I was hopping. I had already paid my full stay through Expedia but they still needed a Credit Card which I don't have, last time at the Beverly Hilton they just ask me for a 200 usd deposit, but at first the guy just told us "This isn't how we do it here" a bit rude, but after checking with his manager we just put a deposit. The check out was very good and fast. Normally it's at 12:00 p.m. but they leave us check out until 1:00 p.m. without charges Because of the guy rudeness Im putting a 4.1 out of 5 Room The room was very nice with two double beds. The bathroom had a shower, which I thought it was a tub, and some great body lotions and shampoos. The t.v. is probably the coolest t.v. I've ever seen in a hotel, inside a furniture, WOW! There is also a desk with an internet cable (it should be already included!). What I really thought it was a bit dangerous it was the metals next to each bed and the lamp of the desk, my son hit himself twice!! I booked the room and the flight together but the room itself was about 230 usd per night, very good price and it was a Premiere room, which cost me 20 usd in total more and the only extra is that we were at the last floor and had two bottles of Evian. Before coming we asked for a nice view of the hills and 50% of our view was the Hospital, then a little bit some buildings and just a bit of the hills. The pool has better views and is on the 6th floor. I really liked the room I just thought the view could have been better. I give out a 4.6 out of 5 Restaurant We never had lunch/dinner at The Bazaar but it seemed cool. Anyways we had breakfast at the TRES, very expensive. Their eggs for adults are just greats but for kids are not. The food was good but seriously 8 usd for an orange juice? I know it's Beverly Hills but it just seems a lot. And then we had an issue the last morning with the waiter ALEX, he was asking something and I was translating it to my son, and because we didn't order he really got angry. The mexican waiter and the blond lady were just amazing in their work. Price, service and because of food I give a 4.4. Location I think this hotel has the best locationI've ever stayed at L.A. Last time I stayed at the Beverly hilton and the Beverly Wilshire both at Beverly Hills, but I'm not going to buy at Rodeo Drive so this hotel is just great. At the edge of Beverly Hills, is just 2 blocks away from the Beverly Center mall. There is a beautiful house car that it was always available so it can drive you to The Grove, Hollywood Blvd, Robertson, etc.. The best thing is that I didn't had car, (parking is 33 usd a night, EXPENSIVE!), and I spent less than 200 usd of taxi, including to the airport. The only bad thing is that is right to a hospital, so at least you will hear a lot of ambulances I give out a 4.9 Service Well apart from the Alex at the Tres and the check-in guy everything else was great. The housekeeping, the driver, the waiters, the concierge were very good. The concierge mad our stay. First we asked for a tour next day for the celeb house, but apparently he thought we didn't want it so he didn't booked it, but anyways Alex (Concierge) booked us for the best private tour of the Celebrity Houses, THE BEST TOUR I'VE EVER TAKEN. I will give out a 4.7 Amenities The hotel has a great pool at the 6th floor but because of the weather we didn't used but it was a really glamorous pool. I liked the House Car service, it saved us a lot of $$. There is also a business center, 6 usd for 15 minutes! and there is a Spa and a Fitness Center which looked fine. Apparently if you have a dog they will also give you an amenity kit. I give out a 4.7 Value/Price We booked the whole trip with Expedia and it was 2000 usd for 3 with airplane included from Mexico and 3 nights. So yes! it was less than 250 usd per night. I've seen reviews that said that it's the same price like the Four Seasons, but not for me. Something I really didn't liked was the over-priced breakfast. I give out 4.8 Overall. Great hotel, with bizarre decoration, I've never got to know what kind of decoration was, but still cool. It has an amazing pool and staff. The rooms are just very nice and the location is the best part. So the big question? Would I will stay here again? 90% yes, if I can find a low rate like this one, but I might try another hotel. I give out 5 points to this 4-diamond hotel in West Hollywood. I hope this review can help, wait for photos.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: WelcomeShawn12
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently for business. This last stay my wife was able to join me for a special occasion. I let the SLS hotel know that she would be coming. They made me wait 5 minutes extra and then up-graded me to a signature suite. 30 minutes later they arrived with champagne and strawberries (Complimentary). The experience made me look like a hero to my wife. I love the hotel and will stay there again every opportunity that I get. This place is amazing, service, food, staff, on and on and on!! Shawn

Reviews.Title: “Very luxurious hotel with excellent attention to detail in making their guests stay wonderful”
Reviews.Author: moNYC30
Reviews.Content: My husband was on business and myself and two young girls were in LA for leisure- the hotel perfectly accommodated us both. This hotel you can tell takes pride in the details in making sure everyone has a great experience at their property. From the second we walked into the hotel the staff was warm, friendly and professional. All the staff we encountered kept making sure all our needs were met. The lobby of the hotel has a great vibe, the complimentary morning coffee was a great brew and the bar at Tres is a great place for happy hour and wee hours. The rooms were very well appointed- all the amenities were luxurious and the room itself was super spacious and the dÃ©cor and design â€“ practical and unique. I highly recommend spending time at the rooftop pool- with its breathtaking views of the city â€“ it is a nice sanctuary and enjoyable place to catch a drink and relax. We travel to LA often and have stayed in many hotels in the Beverly Hills area- and this one has become our new favorite- we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay when visiting LA!!!!”
Reviews.Author: alabamawurley
Reviews.Content: From the moment I booked the hotel online to the generous kitchen staff who accomodated me upon my early departure, the SLS is only place to stay when visiting LA. I have stayed in every major hotel in the area and this hotel offers everything. It has an extraordinary balance of chic modern flair and quiet serenity.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Super”
Reviews.Author: amanwarren
Reviews.Content: Was a bit fearful when I drove up and saw taxi/limo congestion in the driveway and hordes of people milling about outside (an event had just ended, i think)....but once i figured out which was the entrance to the hotel and not the restaurant and bar, i entered a scene of high, yet warm, design, welcomed by a great check in desk guy, who told me I was getting upgraded, let me know without asking how to get logged on to the wireless, etc. My room was pretty amazing -- think updated Sanderson Hotel in London. Great large room, great bathroom and shower, lots of interesting touches throughout the room and hotel. SLS combines the frenzy of LA with the warmth of a first rate hotel -- not easy to do. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Staffs were very snobby”
Reviews.Author: Justtrytorelax
Reviews.Content: I am a royal starwood customer. I have stayed at starwood properties over 130 days this year. So I have accumulate quiet a bit of points. I used my points to book one night at the SLS. When I arrived at SLS, the staff really made me feel like I don't belong there. Let's start with the front office staff. When I asked if there is an upgrade available, I quote," Oh I am sorry its not available, 65% of our guests tonight are platinum member booked with their points" followed by giggles from the rest of the front off staff. This was uncalled for in my opinion. He could just told me that it is not available and that would have been end of it. Any time I asked the front office staff for anything it was I am sorry we can't help you. This was extremely frustrating. Then the valet. We rented an infiniti G37 from hertz. when we picked up the car the valet boys were convinced that the car does not belong to us. He verified and re-verified our ticket. I thought that was a bit odd but it didn't bother me that much. They were trying to be responsible. Overall I feel like if you are not in your best dress clothe, don't bother coming to this hotel. But for the average frequent traveler, we don't travel with our LV and diamond. You are better off going to a W hotel across the street. Out of all the starwood/ hyatt/hilton hotels i have stayed at. SLS has the worst front office staff.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique chic”
Reviews.Author: L0RD_C
Reviews.Content: Somewhere between a warm cosy B&B and a funky party hotel. The SLS comes with Philippe Starck design expertise and chef JosÃ© AndrÃ©s yummy food in the Bazaar restaurant. I had a King-sized room which was very comfortable. The bathroom walls opened up so I could see the TV when shaving! Lots of slate and stainless steel. Very quiet. The staff were incredibly friendly, helpful and charming. If there were any negatives it would the dimmed lighting in the public areas - you can't wear your sun glasses indoors that's for sure. And the breakfast on offer in the lobby was disappointing... very little choice. I ended up going with the soft egg which was just bland gloop, and the coffee cups are too small. But apart from that the hotel is in a great location, with the Beverly Centre just a block away. There's also a great roof top pool with the usual LA-style cobana's to enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Sadly Lacking Satisfaction”
Reviews.Author: honeyandwine
Reviews.Content: This the letter I forwarded to SLS, They ask you to make up own words to SLS. Thank you for your reply to my letter, I sent it a few days after we stayed with you and had wondered why no reply, yesterday I discovered my other email program had not sent so I apologize for my tardiness in contacting you. My concerns fall into three categorys. I travel a lot and stay in a variety of settings, including small motels, bread and breakfasts, larger motels and 4/5 star hotels. This holiday was shared with my sister who does not travel so often and was a special time for us to share, she did ask me how much I had paid for giving her the experience of SLS but I did not tell her, I was too embarrassed. You did however provide my primary reason for choosing your hotel, proximaty to The Getty Museum and safety. 1. Decor : I know you are proud of your designer and some features are striking. However I do not want to spend my time in someones fantasy of modern art. Our room with its many mirrors with no real benefit but one and the there was no ceiling mirror to enhance that one use. The mirror between bed and bath served no purpose As you could not even clean teeth from room side. The beds while comfortable are surrounded by edges that could do someone real damage if they slipped. I want to do my retail therapy in a shop not in my room, every where you looked things where being sold from the fridge to the bathroom. My sister and I where afraid to touch anything. There was no coffee making facility in the room, we where told on departure it is in the foyer, but who wants to get dressed to get a cup of coffee. The bathroom required a degree in mechanical engineering to turn on the shower, my sister after 5 minutes woke me to work it out and 5 minutes later we had success. There was no where to place cloths or towels for easy access after shower. Towels where placed to far from shower. I did notice a few hanging hooks but at 5' 2" a little out of my reach. The hand basin is large and to shallow resulting in water going every where when taps turned on. As retired nurse I have a pet pev about Wet surrounds around sinks and allowing germs to breed. While I am in your establishment it should be a place of succor. In the dining room the chairs at the bar where we where sat, while lovely to look at where most uncomfortable. When we asked if there was no where else we could sit we where taken to the smokers area and seated in the only comfortable chairs we encountered. After dinner we where escorted to the sweets are where the tale of the torturous chairs continued. A comfortable 2 person lounge blocked by a heavy table requiring movement to gain access, on the other side 2 mismatched chairs of questionable comfort. 2. Dining Room: We where told about your signature restaurant being Tapas themed which I thought unusual but as my sister and I are small eaters sounded good. So I rang for a table, no room at the inn for paying guests and why we found ourselves perched on the afore mentioned bar stools. We choose 3 dishes to begin, the first a salad arrived quickly. However an hour later we where still awaiting the other 2 dishes. I finally asked our waitress what was going on after what seemed a heated discussion with another waiter our meal appeared not long after. at which time we received one plate with a very tasty base and a few pieces of rare cooked lamb, and another with 3 squares of chicken and 2 dates cut in half with a mustard filling. Both tasted delicious, however as a cook I know it did not take an hour to prepare, This was early in evening and in fact dining room was nearly empty. I did complain at the time and when we had dessert we where not charged for dessert. As I said your staff are excellent and have received good training . I recently had a Tapas lunch in Palo Alto a much happier experience more interesting dessert menu, featuring delicious desserts I had never seen before. 3. Add Ons: As previously stated I stay in many levels of accommodation it never ceases to amaze me that I have to pay for internet access and parking when I pay the most. When I am travelling I want comfort and easy access to a meal that I can enjoy, I thank you for your kind offer, but it is unlikely I will be Los Angeles again. I am a retired Director of Nursing and used to visit patients and relatives to make sure we where doing things correctly. What I took to be a satisfactory performance was if they said like being at home, or like staying in a 5 star hotel so you see I have a high expectation of comfort and caring. I know things have changed but I do remember when I would be greeted with a small bottle of wine or champagne and a chocolate on my bed when staying in a better hotels. Sadly those days have passed.

Reviews.Title: “If you like $70 Bacon and Eggs and $7.00 to print a ticket this is your place”
Reviews.Author: GolfingYogi
Reviews.Content: Constant nickel and diming for a so so room and good service except for luggage and car. Food so so. Nothing unique. Very Noisy at night. Heard everyone that came in late and noisy plumbing. Took forever to get my luggage and car. Not a place if you are going in and out and are busy. Expect to be Charged for every little thing. Most money grubbing hotel ever. If you don't care about value then this is the place for you. Concierge sent us to crappy restaurant. Find your own good restaurant. SPA is small and just has steam but good service. Gym is broken down.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty cool hotel with gracious service people, but”
Reviews.Author: Lv2Trav
Reviews.Content: the exorbitant service charge at the pool area is ridiculous. C'mon, really?

Reviews.Title: “Incredible staff!”
Reviews.Author: casadei
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the SLS Beverly Hills October 24-26, 2010to celebrate my best friendâ€™s 50th birthday. It was a great experience overall and we will be returning next year to celebrate my 50th as well. We flew in to Burbank Airport, although the hotel is almost the same distance from LAX. The hotel does not offer shuttle services to the airports although they will arrange car services upon request. Cab fare from Burbank to the SLS will run you about $55 if there isnâ€™t any traffic, so plan accordingly when deciding whether it is more cost effective to hire a car service or take a cab. STAFF The hotel staff and service are incredible. Concierge - I was in email contact with our concierge, Alex Niezgoda, several times prior to our arrival. Alex was able to readily obtain the reservations for even some of the toughest restaurants for us, as well as being a valuable source of information. Once we arrived, we received excellent and professional service from all of the concierge staff. BONUS points for Alexâ€™s expertise and assistance. Bell Captain/Valet â€“ friendly, efficient service every time Front Desk â€“ Also friendly, slightly less efficient, but still exceptional. Minor hitch â€“ we had requested early check in because our flight arrived a bit before noon. Upon arrival, our room wasnâ€™t quite ready. However, the Bell Captain secured our luggage and we went to lunch at Tres while we were waiting. As soon as it was ready, they came and found us in Tres and brought us the keys. Housekeeping â€“ great job! Our room was spotless throughout our stay. Transportation â€“ BONUS points for our driver, Daniel. The SLS has three vehicles available to take guests to any destination within a 3 mile radius of the hotel â€“ an Audi, a Range Rover, and the â€œjet vanâ€�. Bear in mind that the hotel does not provide return service so keep your cell phone handy to call Yellow Cab to pick you up when you are ready to go back to the hotel. I would suggest sticking with Yellow and avoiding United as we had a very bad experience with a United driver â€œgetting lostâ€�. We were lucky enough to have Daniel as our driver throughout our stay, and we canâ€™t say enough about what a wonderful job he does. Daniel is extremely knowledgable about the area in particular and LA in general. He was a significant contributor to making our trip stress free and successful. Wait Staff â€“ TRES â€“ our waiter at Tres was Alexander. Excellent service, cheerfully provided, with solid knowledge of the menu. Kudos to Alexander. BAZAAR â€“ our waiter was the one true DISAPPOINTMENT of the weekend, the only NEGATIVE to our experience. We had a 6:30 reservation on Sunday, the 24th. We sat at a table in the red room right in front of the cotton candy machine. Our waiter was more interested in repeatedly, loudly, berating one of his colleagues who was serving â€“ or trying to serve â€“ a nearby table than he was in answering our questions regarding the menu. Every time we started to ask him a question he would suddenly dart away and begin chastising the other server. Itâ€™s a good thing that the rest of the Bazaar serving staff filled in the gap, as our main server was largely absent until the end of the meal. His behavior made all of the guests distinctly uncomfortable. While I certainly intend to eat at Bazaar again next year, I am hoping that I will not be subjected to that serverâ€™s unacceptable behavior when we return. His lack of respect and poor performance stood out that much more strongly in comparison to the gracious service we received from everyone else we dealt with at the hotel. THE FACILITIES The Room â€“ We stayed in Room 523, a Premier Double. The beds were extremely comfortable, and the D Porthault sheets are a treat. I love the clean, modern lines of the room and the minimal clutter. At the SLS it is all about the unique details â€“ like the ironing board with the open bird cage on the cover, and the flying bird on the back wall of the closet. The bathroom, with its sliding walls is elegant, yet comfortable. If you are short like I am though, be very careful with the deep soaking tub. It can be tough to climb back out of! I think half the fun of staying at the SLS is wandering through the public areas trying to spot as many of the funky and whimsical elements that are at the core of its design. If Tim Burton has designed a hotel, the SLS would be the result. FOOD Jose Andres and his team â€“ Wow! Donâ€™t bother eating anywhere else while you are there. Stick to Bazaar and Tres. All in all it was everything we hoped for in a celebration weekend. So much so, that I have cancelled the trip I had originally planned for my birthday next year and we will be returning to the SLS instead!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Hotel, But Bathroom Amenities Absolutely Gross”
Reviews.Author: 1oc
Reviews.Content: I kept reading about the *squeeze bottles* and didn't really understand what people are talking about. But although this is a small point in the scheme of things - if you are paying $400+ a night for a luxury hotel, you don't expect to share bottles of soap, shampoo etc., with previous guests. Quite gross. They need to fix this ASAP. I am not returning until they do and feel compelled to write to Starwood corporate about it. In the meantime, I am hoping my wife packed shampoo and soap by chance, otherwise need to go shopping. Otherwise the hotel is chic, happening and cool. Great for people-watching, the pool (on a sunny day), gym... the staff are very helpful (in fact, probably the most knowledgeable and helpful staff in all Starwoods I've stayed in this year). This is certainly a step up from the hotels in downtown LA in the Starwood group (I have not stayed at the W in Hollywood, so cannot compare to that property).

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful Hotel :) Hats off to Sam Nazarian, the owner”
Reviews.Author: Baharjoun
Reviews.Content: From the gorgeous Ambiance to the gigantic designer shampoo bottle that can be used for two weeks every day and you will not run out to its very clean, simple yet modern design I need to say it was the most beautiful hotel that I have stayed in. Excellent Location and fantastic service. I recommend it 100 % though pricey but it was WELL worth it. Don't forget Jose Andres' Famous Bazar restaurant located in this hotel and the very interesting night lounge that has to offer for guest to come and hang out :)

Reviews.Title: “For the Hipster only”
Reviews.Author: InglishSanLuisObispo
Reviews.Content: The nicest and most helpful person was probabaly the lowest paid person, the young man that parked our car. Overall the staff seemed to have a very stuffy attitude. The place is to swanky for my taste, the public areas and the rooms were very dark and poorly lit. The tub & shower was hard to figure out how to use, let alone to get in and out of. Could be a hazzard. Front entrance is a smokers paradise. You feel like you are infringing on a private party when you walk up the stairs into the hotel lobby. Concierge was not very helpful. We were not told about the car service offered from the hotel, so we just walked to the Grove (about 1.5 miles) nice walk past many cool stores and restaurants, down 3rd street. When we were ready to leave, we asked a security guard as to where we could get a taxi back to the SLS and they told us about the car serivce. So we called the SLS and asked them to pick us up. They told us that they were busy helping guests get to places and they did not pick up there guests. Never did they offer "can we call a cab for you" or "here is a number for a cab company." They just said sorry, end of call. We were at the hotel for a short stay, but for the money, it just did not have the feel that we were looking for. Not the refind exlegance that one would expect at a Luxury Collection Hotel. The downfall of the hotel is customer service. I had very high expectations coming to a hotel like this.

Reviews.Title: “stupidly chic”
Reviews.Author: JillWEvergreen_CO
Reviews.Content: The low points: This hotel is gimmicky to the extreme. The very creepy video portraits, which change from Elizabethan men and women into monkeys is the stuff of nightmares. The guest room I shared with my sister was dark and poorly lit. It took us 15 minutes to figure out how to turn on the shower, and we needed to hold onto the wall to get into it, in spite of the fact that she is a triathlete and I'm a runner and cyclist. The sink in the bathroom is large, leaving very little counter space around it. As stated in another review: the outdoor "lobby" is smoke-filled, and the music is way too loud, even at 7am. The breakfast "table", at $24/head, consists of 3 kinds of cold cereal, some cured meats, mini bowls of yogurt and fruit, pastries and fruit. Quite the rip-off. The highlights: The Bazaar was fabulous! Incredible, inventive cuisine. The staff was friendly and helpful. The bar menu was the most interesting I've seen. This is a place to party with friends, and see and be seen, but not to spend the night.

Reviews.Title: “Trendsetters over travellers here”
Reviews.Author: Cooeee
Reviews.Content: Conceptually the idea of a social hot spot and a stylish hotel combined, seems a natural enough marriage, but in reality, their conflicting needs make it hard to pull off. For instance while Philippe Starck's signature eclectic opulent style is clearly in evidence, it fights for supremacy on your senses as guests must walk through what is essentially an outdoor smokers room every time they come and go from the hotel. It might be cool for those wishing to smoke and be seen there, but it makes for an awful gauntlet to run for guests. The front desk staff are professional in the extreme, confusing being professional hospitality with being a hospitality professional, they lack warmth and sincerity and I would say they're more officious than empathetic to a traveler's needs. The bathroom is large but the room was small but stylish and well appointed, but that's not appreciated when the logistics of the novel wardrobe or room door in the room next door are being repeatedly left to close without the necessary human assistance to stop it slamming at 1 or 2am. And judging by the noise permeating the paper thin hotel room door from guests returning to their rooms all night, the party palace nightlife is obviously fun, but not when you want to sleep after a 14 hour flight and be prepared to do business the next day. I was repeatedly woken each night of my stay this way. On one night, an exotic car was left idling in the hotel driveway and the reverberation came through to the hotel room, suggesting the acoustics seem to have been compromised in construction, which is less than ideal given the dual purpose of the hotel. I wasn't aware of the hotel courtesy cars when I booked, but had I known I wouldn't have had need of a hire car, as I could have used the cars within the hotels requirements. My hire car sat valet parked most of the three days I was there. The restaurant in the lobby and the Bazaar are both good at what they do and I enjoyed both of them. Although I can't see them changing the 'smokers gauntlet' anytime, I would give the SLS another chance because of it's location and as it's a relatively new facility, but I would ask for a room at the end of the hall and up high to avoid the noise from the driveway and partying guests getting to their rooms. I'd have some disclaimers if I recommended it to anyone. If you don't care about sleep or you can sleep through anything, you would probably like the hotel - especially if you're a 'trying to be cool' smoker!

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected...only one slight let down”
Reviews.Author: Mike-O-86
Reviews.Content: I've been meaning to write this review for months now. I'm from the UK and I visited LA for the first time with family. Firstly the hotel definately had the wow factor, very modern, very clean, very hollywood. The rooms were clean and nicely decorated...actually liked the wierd bathroom door that people on here don't like so much. The service was amazing, concierge were so helpful with our first trip to LA. They managed to get us great reservations at restaurants such as XIV (best table in the house btw). Also they drop you off in STYLE! The merc shuttle bus was cool, but they also have cars such as top of the range audis and mercs. Really can't say enough about concierge, trying to remember names...Waldo was cool, Freido knew everything about where to go and Laurie(?) was sooo resourceful. Warner Bros left the tag on my souvenier t-shirt and Laurie manged to get it sorted for me - t-shirt back at my door within 30mins!! I really hope i got the names correct as they are doing their jobs WELL! There was one guy however that often worked at the same time as Laurie who was unneccassarily rude ALL the time... wish I could remember his name LOL. If it wasn't for him, I would've rated service as 5. Pool = v cool, just wish it didn't close at 9. Expect to see celebs! lol I'm back in LA in Feb, want to stay here but it's full :( Maybe I'll still checkout the Bazaar ?

Reviews.Title: “depressing would never stay again”
Reviews.Author: travelalot025
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks hip & cool but the rooms are V ordinary - although the furnishings are quite nice it feels really dark and boxed in, actually quite depressing!! I'm in a studio suite and it's like being in a dark little hole, no view whatsoever, no bath and stinks of cigarettes! I'm booked here for 10 days - no way I can stay here AWFUL!!!! I travel 6 months of the year and are fortunate to be able to stay in V nice hotels - sadly this not one I could recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, good service, average dining, a few quirks.”
Reviews.Author: venicerenee
Reviews.Content: As a Platinum SPG member, a luxury weekend away is a rare and wonderful experience. We stayed at the SLS for a fun night away and hoped for an equally indulgent dinner experience. The hotel was nice, but the Premier Rooms were a bit small. Service was very good, but had a quirky problem with the wrong name associated with our room...called front desk 3 x's to have it changed, but they never fixed it. Had drinks & Tapas in the renowned Bazaar restaurant/bar. Service was terrible - watched our drinks sit on the bar ready for pickup, for 10 minutes. Staff was gossiping about clientele and tapas were salty and over priced for the quality. We went to Morton's next door to eat - which was wonderful and recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Hotel, Expensive Food & Drink”
Reviews.Author: ustehkc
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 days. Reminded me of a Hotel W with a unique twist. Pros 1) Big, clean room 2) Nice staff 3) Hotel car service was available to take us to Rodeo drive Cons 1) Very expensive drinks and food (Mojito costs $16.00). My wife and I ate had 2 appetizers and a few drinks and spent almost $150.00 2) Pool area is very crowded 3) Lots of smoking going on in the front door entry area, which moves into the main reception area 4) location - hard to walk to anything worthwhile 5) shower did not get hot (luke warm every shower)

Reviews.Title: “If you liked Tim Burton's Alice in Wonderland you'll love this place--I didn't.”
Reviews.Author: mommythek
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the SLS got mixed reviews. The teenagers thought it was cool; my husband found it stylish and innovative. I thought it was too weird to really feel comfortable. The whole Phillippe Stark style made me feel like I was at MoMA (or maybe a less celebrated Modern art museum)--the pool, especially, surrounded by frames and mirrors was just too weird for me. It was basically like Tim Burton's vision of Alice in Wonderland--if you liked that, you'll love this hotel. The furniture was all meant to be impressive but not particularly functional, For example, there were not outlets near the bed, and the side tables, while chic, didn't have full shelves so things kept slipping down onto the floor. The shower doors did not close well so things kept dropping to the floor when the door was "slammed." One had to walk behind the bed to get places, and trip on wires (ah--there were the outlets!!) Service was good--the valet staff was very friendly and prompt and the registration desk was staffed by energetic people. They raved about the fitness center which turned out to be just okay. I didn't need the concierge at all, which is probably just as well--I'm sure they could have directed me to clubs, etc., which I am way too old for. Bottom line: not the right scene for a suburban mom.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated glamour, outstanding service.”
Reviews.Author: smcp
Reviews.Content: We stayed a the SLS for 5 nights. It is a great location in Beverly Hills and easily accessible. The Hotel is similar in style to a Schrager hotel - oversized pieces in the reception area, digital art, mood lighting and sound. So from the get go I would say that unless you place some value on innovative design and modern interpretations it is not going to be for you and that you would be better off with a more traditional luxury hotel. I am Platinum with Starwood, booked a standard room and got a Terrace Room which has a decent outside space - a nice option. So check in desk was exceptionally helpful, in fact the experience with all the staff has been positive from the lobby to the two restaurants to the valets. The rooms value design over function - expensive custom furniture and lighting, an oversized shower (no bath) - but very little space for clothing and storage. There are opulent touches such as the hand blown glass lighting, smoked mirror that hides a TV and custom Stark furniture. Beds are very comfortable. Couple of comments: the oversized toiletry bottles are not for take away and I personally like the large bottles as opposed to fiddling with tiny things to squeeze out little globs. However, although the texture of the products are very nice the SLS have missed a trick by not having a signature scent for any of the products - they are simply bland. The towels too are not bath sheets and feel rather cheap to me for a hotel of this standard. The bath robes though are large and luxurious - the kind you want to lounge in all day. Food for breakfast is expensive other then the buffet which again is innovative and a nice follow through from the superlative Bazaaar which is a must try - incredible food. The pool area can be a little intimidating - clearly pitched to the beautiful people of LA but again I found no problem with the attitude of the staff there. Valet was efficient - you pay the one charge for the entire day, in and out as many times as you want. Overall I was very pleased with my stay and would recommend the experience to couples or singles looking for an innovative, sophisticated stay with lots to admire.

Reviews.Title: “Complete lack of Coordination”
Reviews.Author: rachilde
Reviews.Content: From the starstruck people at reception oozing, "It's Emmy Week!" as an excuse for everything to the attitude laden rooftop pool, (it says Altitude on the door, but that is clearly a misspelling), this place lacks the coordination and grace of truly great local hotels in the area such as the Chateau Marmont and the Sunset Marquis. This place plays at being a Hollywood in spot but fails at every turn, which is a pity, because the Bazaar Restaurant is a great place to dine. It was on the strength of the restaurant that I recommended the hotel to my sister to stay in - a recommendation I now very much regret. Guests are charged each time there car goes in and out of the hotel, so I attempted to get a taxi to get home instead of having my sister incur charges. The parking staff was so unorganized that they gave taxi to someone just leaving the adjacent lobby dining area. Then they asked if I was going to Rodeo Drive. No, thanks. I am not a tourist, but a local who has no need to go there. Someone ordered the hotel car but it was never entirely clear if it was meant for me or not because the parking staff were not communicating with each other. After waiting interminably I just walked home, as itw as less than two miles. When friends from out of town ask where to stay I will NEVER EVER recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “not a five star hotel”
Reviews.Author: masstrav
Reviews.Content: For the price, this hotel is NOT WORTH IT. We were ready to stay at the Four Seasons, but saw this hotel and thought it might be fun. Boy, were we wrong. My dad is disabled, which I told the staff when I booked. No walk in shower, and the room was a LONG walk from the elevator. You CANNOT get a seat by the pool unless you get there very early in the morning ala Cancun, or pay exorbitantly for a "cabana". The staff at the pool is rude. The rooms are very dark, and it is not easy to tell where the light switches are. I had to ask twice at 1 and 3 pm for our room to be cleaned. I was extremely disappointed. Go with the four seasons if you are going to spend the money.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is Amazing in almost every way! I would definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: ATLflyer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many fine hotels throughout the world including Peninsula's and many Ritz Carlton and Four Seasons properties and am a Platinum SPG member. Upon arrival my co worker and I were met by some of the friendliest and best hotel staff I have encountered in a long time. The bellman was extremely professional and even showed my co woreker how to use everything in her room and let her know where she could find me down the hall. The hotel does all the little things right from having complimentary almonds and lemonaide in the afternoon to having a seperate cabana set up for platinum guests at the pool. Everyone at the ffront desk and concierge desks are available to help and are always eager and happy to be helpful. The Mercedes and Audi towncars are a great addition and Lionel and Frank are great and helpful. My co worker and I would both return the next time we are in LA. I will say there was one thing that was strange but I never did have my room turned down even though I had requested it. All in all though a very minor complaint and this is a GREAT hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy”
Reviews.Author: RLevy1
Reviews.Content: Whether or not you'll like this hotel depends on what you're looking for. The SLS is incredibly beautiful. It is probably one of the most aesthetically pleasing hotels I've ever stayed in. In fact, the lobby is outside the hotel. With all that said, it is not the warmest hotel. The place is designed to be the new LA hot spot, not a home away from home. A friend of mine came to visit me at the hotel and had to pay for valet because there is hardly any street parking. The valet is not cheap, so it was unfortunate that there were no other real options. There is also an extra charge for pretty much anything in the room itself (internet, certain toiletries, and even dice that they put there as decoration). So, if you're looking for a modern, unique, hip place then the SLS is perfect for you. If you're looking for a place where you'll feel comfortable and at home, then you might want to keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Would go back in a minute!”
Reviews.Author: dbeals
Reviews.Content: Used SPG points + cash for a $185 room rate. We were upgraded to a suite. Room modern and beautiful. Service superb! Who cares (see previous reviews) that there are large bottles of shampoo and soap. Much more environmentally conscious than small disposable bottles

Reviews.Title: “The Place to be Seen”
Reviews.Author: noni40
Reviews.Content: The SLS was full of contradictions: An extremely pleasant staff and the best restaurant in Los Angeles, Bazaar. But the rooms, though spacious, put design over function. The eggshape bath/shower is a perilous option. No reading light over the bed and, worst of all, sliding panels into the bathroom which amplify every noise. People watching is great in a series of lobby bars.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! I'll definitely be back :)”
Reviews.Author: moncrawford
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the SLS hotel for the first time this past weekend, and absolutely loved it! I lived in Los Angeles about 20 years ago, and this was my first time back in about 13 years. While I don't think the scene will appeal to everyone, it was perfect for me. The most enjoyable part of my stay was the spa experience, I love, love, loved the decor and my body treatments were superb. I highly recommend Julia. I added a bath to my services which was heavenly, and will definitely return to experience the couples package in the very cool spa bath suite. I enjoyed the brunch and the bar had a very upbeat and vibrant atmosphere. Poolside was relaxing. I appreciated the privacy options at the dining areas and poolside. Can't beat the location in terms of access to shopping, dining, nightlife. Overall, very sexy hotel. I don't think the older Peninsula Hotel-type crowd would enjoy it, but would definitely suit the hip and upbeat of any age.

Reviews.Title: “WOW....AN AMAZING EXPERIENCE AT A 5 STAR LEVEL”
Reviews.Author: SeaCaroline
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed every singe unique touch to this hotel. The rooftop pool and bar are a must. The rooms were incredible.....nothing like we had ever seen before. Both Restaurants, Bizarre and Tres were outstanding. If you are looking for a place that will take you into the future of the hotel industry. This hotel is a must. We dined at the famous restuarant Bizarre, and we were very impressed. This is a boutique hotel, and everthing from style to design will take you into the future of how we define space and community. Excellent and refreshing.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: PDXStocks
Reviews.Content: I'm a Platinum SPG member. We stayed at SLS because of Bazaar and the reputation of Jose Andres. To me the hotel is kind of a juiced up W where the guest better be willing to part with a LOT of cash. When I checked in I was told I was upgraded to a Studio Suite and that room is the only room they upgrade Platinum members. I would love to see a standard room, because our room would not be described by many people as a suite. Was it somewhat larger than a typical hotel room....maybe? I guess it would depend on who you were talking to. So we got upgraded to a larger room and the decor is very typical of a W. I thought the amenities were tacky. They provide oversized plastic bottles of shampoo, body wash, conditioner, which I am positive that if a guest took one they would get charged. For those of you who enjoy taking nice amenities when you leave, there's NO reason to take them. When I'm dropping well in excess of $300/night on a hotel room I want to see L'Occitane or Bulgari or something name brand plastered on the amenities. I don't want to see generic "made for the SLS" shampoo. Furthermore, do I want to handle the soap bottle after the last guest who used the toilet or had God knows what else on his hands? This was a bigger issue for me. Yeah, it's a funky quirky vibe the designers are going for with the reusable soaps/conditioner, and I'm sure it's green because they aren't wasting as much plastic, but I'm about not handling things other people have handled. As per other guests critiques, there isn't a bathtub, probably because there isn't room for it, even though we were supposedly upgraded to a suite! HA. Closet space is fine, but the ironing board is a strange little thing meant to sit on the table top. I've never seen anything like it. CHEAP would be the word that comes to mind. It wasn't trendy or minimalist, so all I can think is they needed to save money. The rooms are HIP, modern and minimalist. If you're not comfortable walking through a Design Within Reach store then this isn't the place for you to stay. A friend suggested it's more along the lines of Roche Bobois, but I can guarantee the furnishings don't come anywhere near the price point of Roche. Lighting is dim, which wasn't a problem for us, but others might not enjoy the look. I actually thought the room was quite pleasant and the bed quite comfortable, but CLEARLY not worth the final bill. So, other details. The Sunday brunch was $38/person and $48 with a cava Mimosa. We thought it was too much like a continental breakfast. Little pastries, chocolate, yogurt, fruit cups. There was caviar (we don't eat caviar) and there was Lox and also some roast beef being carved....otherwise it felt like continental breakfast on steroids. We opted for the choice without the cava Mimosa. Price for two with tax and tip $96. Not exactly a bargain. Parking $35. Depending on your arrival and departure from the hotel I would suggest parking on the street around the hotel and using meters. With a little ingenuity you can bypass the fee. On Sunday we sat poolside (it's a small pool) on the 6th floor and enjoyed watching the 20 somethings that the hotel personnel kept escorting up to the pool area. The signs are explicit that hotel guests only are at the pool, but we noticed that the younger set would be escorted from the lobby by the help and allowed into the pool area, which was packed and had a variety of guests waiting for cabanas and chairs. There is a DJ on Sundays and the music is thumping. This is the same company that owns the Abbey nightclub in West Hollywood and I think they are trying to cultivate an atmostphere at the pool and fill it with young Hollywood wannabees who think it's glamorous to have entree into a swank hotel's pool area for a Sunday DJ party. We had two drinks, thank God. The mojito is just $16 and a Campari $13. With automatic 20% gratuity added and the tax we went back to our room with a $38 bill....for two drinks!!! The Sangria is $50 a pitcher, so imagine with food what kind of bill some guests run up during the day. One of my friends who parties constantly around Beverly Hills suggested that SLS attracts a lot of younger wealthy persian/middle eastern 20 somethings. I thought that was an odd comment, until we got to the pool on Sunday. Same with Bazaar, the later it got the more it felt like a Persian nightclub. And the best part for the hotel is they appeared to be spending, spending, spending. Dinner at Bazaar was wonderful. $55 prix fixe is the way to go. They have several tapas and unless you just want one or two items, it will be far cheaper to order the set tasting menu. Also, we chose to drink tap water over the sparkling or still they try to sell. Most are only $10 a bottle and yes they have quite a selection. Some of the beer is reasonably priced as is iced tea and sodas. Hot tea $8. Here the cocktails are as high as $20 each and the wines can become stratospheric. It is a wonderful wine list with equally wonderful mark-ups from the labels we recognized. The staff was nice and we had no needs. The gym is great. It's got excellent new equipment and I would highly recommend it. Some woman at the pool was carrying on about her spa treatments.....apparently she wasn't impressed, especially when she got her bill. I'm not sure whether she didn't like noises she heard or whether her services just weren't up to her level of desire. So would we stay here again? After all for one night, brunch, prix fixe dinner and two cocktails at the pool we checked out with a nearly $600 bill. NEVER. It wasn't worth it. We've paid more than that on a few occasions previously, but this just didn't cut it. Would I recommend Bazaar? Absolutely. It deserves all the accolades it receives.

Reviews.Title: “Big Letdown... I do not recommend spending your money here...”
Reviews.Author: mcfeagle
Reviews.Content: As a Starwoods Platinum Preferred Guest, I was excited about my upcoming stay at the SLS Hotel in Los Angeles (NOT Beverly Hills, like it is advertised). I had two free nights so I used them for this stay. Lets just say that I wish I would have used my two free nights at another Starwoods Hotel. When I arrived, I was met with a couple of gentlemen who showed me to the front desk and took my bags. That was nice and welcoming. Let me preface the next part this way: Starwoods nicer hotels, such as St. Regis and Westin, usually treat their Platinum Preferred Guests as VIPs and with warmth and hospitality. In addition to this, their Platinum status is stated upon check-in and they are upgraded to available suits or the next level of rooms. However, when I arrived at the SLS, I had to tell them that I was a Platinum Preferred member and no upgrade was given. Usually, when this happens, they say so, this was not done here. I know that I sound a little snobby, but I have spent plenty a penny through Starwoods Hotels and their standards have been set high by other 6 star hotels, so I have come to expect this sort of treatment at their Luxury Collection Hotels. For instance, when I last stayed at the St. Regis Monarch Beach in Dana Point, CA, I was upgraded to an Executive Suite with Butler Service. It was amazing. When I arrived to the room, I was extremely let down. There were stains on the rug and leather window seat. In addition to this, I really looked forward to soaking in a nice bathtub and when I looked into the bathroom, no tub was found. Big Bummer for me. I really desired to take a nice long bath a read a book. You would think that with the amount they charge at the SLS, a bathtub might be included, but apparently you need to book a Double bedded room and not a King to get this extra attribute. I also booked a Spa treatment at their supposed "renown" Ciel Spa. I do not recommend spending your money at this Spa. The therapist was nice enough, but sped through the massage. The worst thing about the 60 minutes was that the room my massage was in was situated right next the the steam room. The rooms were not sound proofed and this was apparent--There were two rather loud women in the steam room and we could hear their whole, loud, 30 minute conversation. At one point, their loudness drowned out the relaxing music in our room. This did NOT relax me, but annoyed me as I was supposed to be in a tranquil setting. The women continued to loudly talk in the hallway, ruining my experience. The therapist apologized and stated that this NEVER happened to her before. Well, my $215 felt wasted. The therapist seemed to want tot fly through the rest of the massage because it was finished early. When I entered the lounge area, Ciel seems to not be able to clean up after their guests. Every little couch area had garbage and glasses of other guest's leftover drinks; I ended up having to clean off a space to sit. At that point, I did NOT want to be there anymore and left. Have I stated my warning to NOT spend your money here?? This review is very harsh, but I do firmly believe that at 6 star hotels should have a certain amount of class and standards. The SLS Hotel failed to live up to their own hype. Big letdown; go to the ST. Regis Monarch Beach in Dana Point, CA if you would like a classy, luxurious experience. Frankly, I never write bad reviews, but could not wait to get online to do so here :(

Reviews.Title: “The Place To Be!”
Reviews.Author: DKNY74
Reviews.Content: I just spent a few days at the SLS, celebrating my Birthday with friends. Without a doubt, this hotel is the place to be! The rooms are simply amazing, and the pool is over the top, with incredible views of LA (and gorgeous sunsets). Service is exceptional. Location is great, minutes from Rodeo Drive, WeHo, The Grove, etc. As much as I liked exploring outside the hotel, I just wanted to come back and enjoy the facilities.

Reviews.Title: “It's always a pleasure to stay here”
Reviews.Author: amac604
Reviews.Content: We love this place. The cutting edge decor is a feast for the eyes. The rooms are fabulous, the bed and bath is to-die-for. Service is exemplary. The staff here really want you to be happy. The power outlet in our bathroom wasn't working and a decor fixture on the closet door fell off but when we called the front desk they sent up a friendly maintenance guy who fixed everything immediately. They even comped us with a food and beverage credit for our trouble. They really take customer satisfaction seriously here. I recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a unique and memorable luxury hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “I am beyond picky- a true "hotel snob...”
Reviews.Author: writeholt
Reviews.Content: I am beyond picky- a true "hotel snob"- loved everything. Great service from custom items in my mini bar to great concierge staff. Everyone there puts the guest first.

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional and unrefined service”
Reviews.Author: edmoist
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on the final leg of our honeymoon and all I can say is that we were thoroughly unimpressed with the SLS on several fronts. To be fair our expectations might have been a bit high as previous to our arrival we stayed at a Shangri-La and St. Regis hotel, which were both simply spectacular and elegant. On our arrival at the SLS we found half eaten food in our bar fridge, jewelery from a previous guest that was left on the furniture and a strange yellowish pee-stain on the floor. We also found that the shower didnâ€™t drain properly and within minutes nasty murky water was up to our ankles. Although all of these problems were taken care of in due time, that they existed in the first place was really embarrassing for a hotel that prides itself on luxury and refined service. It also set a very negative tone for the rest of our stay What we found most unexceptional about the SLS however, was its staff. Except for the valet guys (who were wonderful) the front desk people were very unprofessional. When we raised our concerns about our room we were bounced back and for the between a bunch of people who were all equally clueless on what to do. One even asked sarcastically if we wanted â€œcompensationâ€� as if we were somehow being rude in asking them to remove a previous guestsâ€™ garbage. In this regard, everything at the SLS was a chore. Even the rustic cabin that we stayed at in Big Sur far surpassed the SLS in customer service and in making our honeymoon experience special. And another thing, if the SLS is going to call itself a luxury hotel here is a little adviceâ€¦it is beyond tacky for their servers to tip themselves on the bill and conveniently call it a â€œservice tax.â€� Tips are earned, they are not an entitlement - especially for a party of 2. Does the staff work under the table or something?!?! On the upside the SLS is fantastically located close to all the action in Beverly Hills and Hollywood. The design and dÃ©cor is certainly unique and interesting and the â€œdiscoveryâ€� aspect of the hotel is fun, savvy and well designed. I spend a lot of time in LA and was hoping to make this my new go-to hotel. Owing to all these issues however, I donâ€™t think I will be returning anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, unique but poor costumer service with lack of care.”
Reviews.Author: Diana0210
Reviews.Content: We liked the hotel but the service was horrible. Once we asked for a fork and a knife and waited for 45 minutes. When i called the manager on duty her reply was that they are very busy. We dined at their restaurant called Bazzar. Food is great but it is impossible to enjoy because you always feel ignored. Generally there is this strange feeling that they don't care at all.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Hotel”
Reviews.Author: michaelbeetoronto
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest Hotels I've stayed at. The rooftop pool is an all day party on Sundays with live dj and great poolside service. A must see. Fresh fruit in the lobby every day. Location is great.

Reviews.Title: “excellent!”
Reviews.Author: M-JMillevent
Reviews.Content: this is a trendy type hoteland is perfect compliment to Los angeles. very modern and elegent also with wonderful bar and restaurant and pool area with bar. i love it here at this SLS hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive fun”
Reviews.Author: raven40
Reviews.Content: SPG knows how to make a hotel look good. And this hotel has been prefectly art directed. And SPG also knows how to charge for EVERYTHING. A muffin and 1/4 cup of fruit in the lobby was $28 .. the coffee in the lobby was free UNTIL I added the food then it was no longer free. However the LA and NY TIMES were available at no charge. SLS Los Angeles is Hollywood hip and expense account priced. But would some one please suggest that the room designers actually spend a night in their dungeons. The room I had was ample but the bed sat in the middle of the room. There was not a comfortable chair. You could either sit on a backless settee or an uncomfortable 'office' chair. If you wished to sit while applying make up or fixing your hair good luck. If you are not a fan of liquid soap good luck. But more than anything each room should have a warning sign explaining the very cool slate or is it granite and glass shower. In order to keep from being soaked before you are ready you must enter the shower and position yourself behind the shower head and then play with the water temperature until you can actually enter the stream. Oh and make sure you remember to bring your towel from the towel stand some 8 feet from the shower, otherwise it is wet and chilly prance to collect it. Staff is best trained SPG staff I have ever encountered. Usual Hollywod movie star wannbes but unlike all the Ws this time with brains

Reviews.Title: “Hip and astylish is as far as you'll get”
Reviews.Author: portochulizco
Reviews.Content: This is yet another example of a hotel that tries to be interesting by pretending to be ultra exclusive. Truth is only about 55 reviewers out of 115 thought the experience was above good. That should be enough to make you wonder.No one that is not staying can even get close to the door. REALLY? please that will never equate to good service. THe PEninsula hotel around the corner is 100 times better without the attitude and you can actually go in and take a peek. The restaurant Bazaar harassed us twice during the day to make sure we would meet our reservation only to give us the table 20 minutes late. THe food was great and the crown was beautiful but it comes at too high a price and I don't mean monetarily.

Reviews.Title: “A really up-scale Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AninhaG
Reviews.Content: Stay ay this Hotel and feels like a celebraty!!! A Phillip Starck Hotel....just this information is enough to describe this incredible Hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Girls' Getaway”
Reviews.Author: mccragun
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so impressive. The staff couldn't have been more helpful and attentive. The ambience is fabulous, dining is exceptional and the location is perfect for a fun weekend in Beverly Hills. The pool was out of this world. I met two girlfriends there. We shopped, ate at the Bazaar and enjoyed incredible services at Ciel Spa. We even used the house car to take us out in the evening. Our one complaint was the poor lighting in the room; but the room itself was comfy and cool. I highly recommend this place and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Hotel, But Slightly Lacking in Detail”
Reviews.Author: kalikidd05
Reviews.Content: SLS is regarded (at least by my friends in LA) as one of the hottest hotels and hottest hang out spots in the LA at the moment. I stayed in the hotel for 3 nights and found the hotel's design very impressive. The TV behind the glass was clever and I really like the rooftop bar. However, the hotel seems to be focusing so much on style that it forgets some of the details. For example, I have gone up to the roof top bar twice, both around cocktail time and no bar tender was at the bar. The shampoos and conditioners and etc also come in big plastic bottles that are refilled, which doesn't seem quite right to me. The front desk and concerige are nice, but do seem a bit cold and arrogant. People show no willingness to help out or even ackownledge your presence. Overall not a bad hotel, but if it could step up slightly in terms of service and attention to detail, then it would become a great hotel

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel but way too expensive extras”
Reviews.Author: bankan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the SLS only one night travelling to LA for business. Really cool and beautiful hotel with a good location near shopping and restaurants and service minded staff. Though I do think the lighting is too dark for a business traveller with work to do, as previous reviewers have mentioned. The pool on the roof is also very nice. There is nothing wrong with the hotel, it is really beautiful and rooms are lovely with comfortable beds and amazing bathrooms. TV is an enormous flat screen and everything is just top class. My only negative comments are the overly expensive extras, that should not be extras in a hotel of this standard. Internet costs 13 dollars per DAY, which is just crazy these days, especially when they make a big deal about lending you a lap top... For the loan of an adapter I was charged 15 (refundable, of course) and breakfast is a massive 25 for the tasty but somewhat small buffet. This to me seems strange when rooms are quite pricy and clientel posh - do I really need to first reserve 500 dollars on my credit card for minibar and then 15 for an adapter? And to me 500 dollars for an overnight stay is way too much money. I also think it's strange not to give any extras at a hotel of this standard. Internet costs as does everything in the room, and I mean e-v-e-r-y-t-h-i-n-g. From the small piece of chocolate to the designer dice to the minibar snacks to the schampoo bottles - everything has a price tag. And you do not get anything when you check in, not even a mint on the pillow. When you pay for this standard a complementary fruit basket would be a nice touch. Instead you have a 10 dollar price tag on the bottle of water that looked like a welcoming gift. Unclassy. I stayed in a room with an extra door, I guess it can be opened to make the next door room to a family room. This caused me problems. My neighbour decided to take someone "home" for the night and woke me up at 3:30. I thought I had Mary J Blige in my room but soon noticed it was his stereo blasting away. I called about this twice and the second time he kind of got the message. I was able to fall asleep but I do wish they had been more firm. I told them I had been travelling for almost 24 hours and had meetings in the morning but they where unable to just tell my neighbour that music is not ok AT ALL at 4 in the morning... At 7 I was woken up by some lovely moaning that really did not leave anything to the imagination. This is just silly for a hotel that wants to be sleek and cool. They should invest in some soundproofed doors. I hate to think what small kids would have been asking mommy would they have stayed in my room. Of course my neighbours lack of brains is not the hotels fault but I just wish they would have offered me to change rooms or told my neighbour to just turn off the music completely.

Reviews.Title: “High on style - Low on comfort”
Reviews.Author: juliecarneilhan
