Reviews.Content: Hip hotel, fashionable crowd, but overall it was way too gimmicky for my taste. My husband and I took a suite for 3 nights and had it not been laziness I would have changed hotels. Our suite was very large, with a full seating area separate from the sleeping area all furnished in high quality modern furniture, however, the furniture placement was very strange, and the lighting was even poorer. I felt like I was moping around in darkness the whole time. There was not a proper mirror to put one's makeup on. I felt the designers sacrificed comfort for shock value and for being "hip". Definitely will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeds All Expectations”
Reviews.Author: hotdrod
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our 1 year anniversery and it was amazing. Even though we live in LA it felt like a full on vacation. The place is decorated beautifully down to the finest detail. The food is also some of the best we have had. The thing that stands out the most about the SLS is the service. All the staff are extremely friendly and stop at nothing to make youre stay more enjoyable. My wife and I have stayed at nice hotels all over the world and the service here is truly unparalleled. They really make you feel special. Can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “SLS = Sensational Luxury Suites”
Reviews.Author: MeganTM
Reviews.Content: Wow! We were very impressed with our whole experience at the SLS. The service was exquiste. We were treated with the utmost in courtesy and service at every turn. The room was exquisite! It was contemporary without being cold and stark. On the contrary, it was filled with clever touches, playfully suggesting variations on the meaning of the initials SLS or incorporating treats such as a fresh apple or chocolates into the decor. There were luxurious touches such as cut crystal glasses and stemware --even in the bathroom for brushing one's teeth! We enjoyed a wonderful evening at The Bazaar with an astonishing array of tapas and a really fun atmosphere. One thing that especially impressed us was that we happened to be nearby several days after our two-night stay and stopped by briefly to show some friends something we'd seen in the gift shop. Not only did the doorman remember us, he greeted us by name! This is luxury with a contemporary, playful, and clever twist. I heartily recommend that you join in the fun!

Reviews.Title: “Very slick hotel - competes with the new W”
Reviews.Author: DorianB
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very hip design...especially in the public areas. Very W-esque but a bit more upscale (feel and price). Guest rooms are very hip...but balconies and exterior of hotel in dire need of a good power wash and/or paint (ie: don't go on your balcony if you have one). Was nice of the hotel staff to really try and remember and use your name when possible. Found bfast expensive...and found the front door staff distracted and/or not there. Need a new hiring manager for the pool...maybe whomever hires for W Scottsdale. The hotel is a 4.5/5...needs to go a bit further for the coveted 5 rating.

Reviews.Title: “Looks like a 5 star, run like a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Imlabella
Reviews.Content: The hotel is gorgeous!!! Everything is really well decorated and the location is very good. But the hotel is run like a 4 star hotel. No water is the rooms or limo. The door men were no where to be found when we arrived and that is really annoying when you're coming with a lot of luggage. The food was ok, but the pastry was really good. The restaurant, lounge, bar and pool are all very well decorated. It was good to check it out but I'll will look for other options next time I'm there.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Bar and nightlife, room is ok”
Reviews.Author: Mindwurkz
Reviews.Content: First off, I'll caveat this review saying that I'm currently staying at the hotel and I've only been here for one night, but I can give you my first impressions. The staff at the hotel are friendly and attentive and overall the design of this hotel is very hip and trendy. The restaurant and bar are excellent and great places for people watching. The rooms are amazingly designed. Period. The Philippe Starck design team has done a wonderful job with the rooms interiors with wonderful accents throughout the room, from the bed's headboard, to the desk. The bathroom's are a work of art. That being said, the rooms are a bit on the dark side, the addition of lamps everywhere breaks some of the sleek modernity of Starck's design. This wouldn't be as much of an issue, but the windows to my room faces a wall. Really, if I wanted to open my window and see a wall, I would've stayed in New York. While my status with SPG isn't particularly great, I am disappointed with my room and hope they do better next week when I return.

Reviews.Title: “So amazing I extended my west coast trip and came back to LA just to spend two extra days at SLS”
Reviews.Author: LeisureTourist
Reviews.Content: One could easily start this review with the absolutely life altering cuisine of the simple Catalan breakfasts to the delectable dinners at Bazar or the awe-striking contemporary functionality of the rooms or even the drippingly chic pool, which by many estimates is one of the best in LA. Yes one could begin with any of thoseâ€¦I have to start with customer service, which in a place like this likely goes unappreciated and frankly is usually not something I'd have high expectations for given the cool rep and hyper-trendsetter status of SLS. I always think evidence is better than exposition so here's my story: I arrived to the hotel on a miserably late flight and of course without any of my checked luggage. Upon check-in and spilling my sob story to the front desk, the night manager promised theyâ€™d handle everything (the airline of course would not deliver the bags to the hotel, as I â€œvoluntarilyâ€� took an earlier, delayed flight after they canceled mine). After a stunningly spectacular dinner at Bazar â€“ donâ€™t miss the Liquid Nitrogen Capirihnias, Jicama Wrapped Guacamole, Toasted Catalan Rustic Bread with/Jamon or the Air Bread Philly Cheese Steak, sipped a few more libations at the bar where its impossible to miss the sinfully gorgeous crowd. I returned to my room, where lo and behold was my lost luggage, which the night manager had gone and retrieved HIMSELF from LAX to be assured it made it back to my possession. Quite simply, the customer service here is 5-star, matching the property and all its amenities â€“ ask about the JetVan it could be the greatest â€œhotel-shuttleâ€� ever! The only way to wrap-up is to say my experience here was so unequaled in an LA hotel, I wonâ€™t stay anywhere else when visiting Glitter City and I extended my trip out west just to go back for an additional weekend. I will unquestionably return and would recommend it to the most discerning, discriminating traveler, business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous experience”
Reviews.Author: DCMarty
Reviews.Content: Have to say that it a very chic, cool hotel. Often that type of hotel can be very cold with it's atmosphere and personnel, but instead the SLS was the perfect balance of "hot spot" and classic elegance. The reviews I read on Trip Advisor had me worried that it might be bad service, but I would say that my experience is that their service excelled in every way. From the valet to the front desk to the concierge to the Tres bar/restaurant to the spa to the pool -- all were incredibly accomodating, knowledgeable and looked for ways to improve the experience. A hotel that I look forward to visiting again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish fun!”
Reviews.Author: duckleader
Reviews.Content: Decor is unique and surprising even though I have been to Starck hotels before. Restaurant Sa'am is amazing. We dined in the private dining room and enjoyed the 21 course gastronomic presentation.......wow. Upper level pool, fun, service a little slow. Rooms are mirrors, mirrors, mirrors but it works well, plenty of room and nice layout(king superior). The concierge was extremely helpful and a big asset to the hotel. Really fun and different for business meetings etc. will absolutely return.

Reviews.Title: “Design and Comfort”
Reviews.Author: lilac1972
Reviews.Content: Had a great first visit to SLS. The design is strikingly original. Not cold and minimal like other Stark hotels. This one is so comfortable, you won't want to leave. Everything has been thought out, down to the faucets, which make for a feast for the eyes. But form follows function, even the sinks and shower have their own unique way of working. The rooms were very spacious for LA and the artsy rooftop a very enjoyable place to not only relax, but there are nooks you can get work done with a cold lemonade. The staff were very helpful, a breath of fresh air in this part of LA. And the restaurant, sublime, an experience to go back for on its own, every bite of tapas a little work of magic. Such a find to be in a hotel where everything was thought of, will definitely be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: hayley32480
Reviews.Content: When you get down on one knee and pull the ring out of the box, you instantly begin to thinkâ€¦location, especially in Los Angeles. My, now, wife and I knew that even with a year, time was of the essence in finding a place we could call our own for a day. A place that would be welcoming to our friends and family, where everyone can talk years later about what a great time they had. We went and looked at the usual venues, but the problem we kept running into was that the usual venues treat you like the usual newly engaged couple. They are working off a script and we wanted something different, something new and fresh. There were two hotels that were under construction when we initially visited them, but there was one major difference between the twoâ€¦the service. Even with the ballroom incomplete and having only artist renderings to go by, we both knew that the SLS was the place for us. The SLS was beyond welcoming, and their events coordinator, Dana Cohen, was what sealed it for us. Dana has the ability to take all the stress out of the equation and with her relaxed approach we took a huge sigh of relief and replaced that stress with excitement. The venue was absolutely stunning, people still talk to us about the short-ribs, and we could not have planned it any better. Perfect moments are a rare thing, and that day had quite a few of them. If you are looking for something different, something wonderful for your wedding we canâ€™t say enough about the SLSâ€¦where it seemed like both Sâ€™s stood for Service.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Wedding Venue”
Reviews.Author: chelse96
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married at the SLS hotel and everything was perfect. The service was amazing, both for our guests as well as ourselves. Dana, our coordinator was incredibly helpful through the entire process. Our guests were impressed with the entire evening from the untraditional food served during the cocktail hour such as the liquid olives to the amazing light fixtures in the ballroom. There was no shortage of staff to refill drinks, serve food and I even had someone by my side the entire night to help with anything I needed. I highly recommend this hotel for any kind of stay in town and especially for a special event.

Reviews.Title: “Experience Good Until..”
Reviews.Author: amydd
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the SLS in Beverly Hills. It is definitely a hip and stylish place - the design elements are great! The meeting room and service there was really good. The rooftop pool is fantastic. As a hotel guest, I agree with other reviewers on some things that aren't great for a business traveler, such as the dim lighting in the rooms. On this trip I had a few issues that have turned me off quite a bit, which is a shame because i want to like this place! I left my room at 7am, returned at 5pm and the room had not been made up. I was deciding whether or not to call and complain/request when there was a knock at the door. The housekeeping staff asked, "do you want your room cleaned?". It just seemed really late and half-hearted. I said no thanks. I also noticed that the shelving around the bed was very dusty - looks like it hadn't been properly cleaned in a few weeks. The bathroom sink had a very slow drain, which is a bit unpleasant with those giant sinks. The biggest turnoff, however, was my experience in the bar/restaurant. Was seated (solo) promptly in the practically empty space. It took quite some time for anyone to come over and acknowledge me - first water, then several minutes later a waiter. I ordered a gin & tonic and a salad for dinner. Took way longer than it should have for the drink to arrive, when it did I noticed/commented that it looked fancy and the waiter agreed. I enjoyed my drink and meal and requested the check. $18 for the gin & tonic!!! I was shocked, the waiter wasn't around and I needed to get going, so I paid the bill but on my way out checked with the hostess. I asked if the drink I ordered is considered a "regular" gin & tonic (I still had the remainder with me). She replied that no, it was considered their SLS Utlimate drink, which had been noted on the bill. I was explaining that I did not order the special version and that I was surprised at the cost and she replied, "well, are you enjoying it?". Please! At that point the waiter came over seeing that I was talking to the hostess and he had some lame explanation that "most people" order the ultimate so that's what he got for me, and he offered an apology - but not to refund the difference in price or any other kind of compensation. I should have demanded that but frankly I had an appointment to get to and had to go. Bottom line, I felt taken advantage of, and when I called them on it they didn't handle it well at all. Next time I will stay elsewhere, even if my meeting is being held at the hotel. Bummer. (PS, there should be a "maybe" choice for the question, Would You Recommend this Hotel to a Friend?)

Reviews.Title: “Superlative in every way”
Reviews.Author: YYZLAX
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ve stayed in much more expensive hotels, but none were even close to this experiance. Truly outstanding facility, and service. I look forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “SLS - A Perfect Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: cototraveler
Reviews.Content: Although we live just an hour away, we often spend the weekend in LA. Our second time at the SLS turned out to be the perfect Valentine's Day get-away. Another amazing meal at The Bazaar, and after enjoying our cocktails, my choice - the delicious cotton candy mojito and my husband loves the nitrogen capirinha, we didn't have to drive anywhere--we were already home. In the morning, a short walk to Joan's on Third for breakfast and shopping at the Beverly Center. The parking is easy in and out, the SLS is centrally located whether heading west to Santa Monica or east to downtown. The hotel staff couldn't have been friendlier and willing to help. During our last stay, I didn't have a chance to enjoy the well equiped fitness center, but this time I took full advantage. The rooms are very modern, a nice change from the more traditional hotel rooms in most hotels and we appreciate the high definition TV tucked away behind the mirrors. This hotel might not be for everyone, but it's an experience we enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Spa needs work...”
Reviews.Author: doberdkhd
Reviews.Content: We just got back home from spending our Anniversary at the SLS Hotel and were very disappointed with our stay. The hotel is beautiful and the food was delicious. The best service in the hotel was the Concierge! But the overall service did not make us happy! Sometimes all it takes is just one person to make the difference... For the highlight of our trip, we went to the spa to relax and indulge. Upon checking in we were rudely ignored by a very flustered and stressed out lady who could not force a smile on her face. After burdening her with our check in, we were nicely escorted to the spa where our day got a little better. Our treatments and therapists were great and we were feeling very pampered. Throughly relaxed and rejuvenated, we went to check out, totally forgetting about the lovely lady at the front (whom we have come to find out is the Manager, Amanda). I guess we may have been looking for some sort of an apology or smile, but realizing all we were going to get was a single finger up in the air, telling us, "one minute". I guess we do not have to explain how all of our pampering went right out of the window! If this is the type of person you have representing your beautiful spa then maybe you will realize why some of your guests may not be returning! To spend money and be treated like you're invading someone's space is not desirable! Great last impression!

Reviews.Title: “SLS: Hip Happening Hotel, but would have loved a warm welcome”
Reviews.Author: 2BoldlyGo
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel is good. I also agree with some of the more general comments having just stayed there. Both the style and design are awesome: 10 out of 10. The room features are also good. Some general thoughts: Positives: 1. Rooms are hip & large-ish 2. The design is amazing, warm and inviting 3. Close to The Beverly Centre (one block) 4. Easy drive up Valet was fast and efficient 5. The staff at the Pool and the Pool itself were both AWESOME. Great for the relaxed young crowd. 6. Room to room insulation, and outside noise insulation is first class and whisper quiet. 7. The Gym was indeed world class - good job! 8. the Business centre PC's were good with free Airline Check in service (nice touch) Negatives: 1. no real views from this location, not the hotels fault. 2. There is absolutely no "in room" sound privacy, if someone is in the bathroom, you hear everything (sorry to be so frank) unfortunately this is a real life design fault. Design vs practicality. 3. The amount of people through the hotel is large and that leads to some unfortunate issues: Concierge was very efficient but not warm, "Bazar" restaurant waiters are "too cool" and rarely present (getting the bill took 15 minutes+). My friendly recommendation: I would strongly recommend the SLS management team to visit the W Hollywood, whose staff were so friendly and amazing they made the hotel world class. Sometimes someone remembering your name and what you talked about with them yesterday makes the place feel like home. The W Hollywood was that for me, rather than the SLS.

Reviews.Title: “Quintessential LA Experience”
Reviews.Author: Marnie33
Reviews.Content: The SLS distills all that is LA into one top-notch experience. It's right in the heart of the Wilshire/La Cienega area, so you could, feasibly, WALK to many shops and restaurants (!), but it's LA, after all, and that would be, like, weird..... The fitness center is sparkling clean, with brand new equipment--and it was nearly empty during the hour I was there. Fun and funky art throughout--reminds me of a book called "Griffon and Sabine," which was published in the 1990's. Surprises and irony around every corner--even a few "memento mori" thrown in for those immortal beautiful people who drop in. Complementary coffee in the downstairs salon every morning, and even a roaring fire. In the winter, this hotel somehow managed to straddle the line between ultra hip and super cozy. Service is seamless, but never stuffy. Ordered room service after coming back from a concert at 1 am and the food was delicious. Had hoped to eat in The Bazaar, but there's always next time.

Reviews.Title: “OK at best - if you get a good deal, maybe!”
Reviews.Author: oakforest2
Reviews.Content: I was at SLS for a bachelorette party. We had 3 rooms booked. First, if you book a room with 2 doubles, know that the beds are "full" NOT "queen" - and the pillows are XL-King pillows, so it's impossible for 2 people to sleep in the bed with their own pillows. Second - it's like a cave in the hotel. There was insufficient light to even put make-up on, and all of the mirrors in the room are tinted. Third - our toilet clogged the first morning, and after calling maintenance twice, after an hour they still hadn't come to the room (we had to go down the lobby bathroom). Forth - if your room key only works 10% of the time in the elevator and room, you are not going crazy. The front desk told us the cards were tricky, and pointed out the elevator to avoid. Those kinds of issues aren't the things that a Hollywood boutique hotel should have. If you get a great rate - then you probably won't mind. I will say that the Hotel Gym was one of the nicest I have been to, so maybe hang out in there - there is plenty of light! I would still recommend the Viceroy over SLS and now that the new W Hollywood opened, I will try to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the bar”
Reviews.Author: welltraveled17
Reviews.Content: While awaiting our reserved table at Bazar for my birthday dinner, no one would acknowledge our presence in the bar to order a drink. The other tables were served in what was an almost empty bar. My Mother-in-law forgot her purse but it was not found.

Reviews.Title: “SLS= Spectacular Lovely Service”
Reviews.Author: arosen15
Reviews.Content: I always check Trip Advisor before and after I book a trip. I have learned to take many comments on this excellent website with a grain of salt. I understand that people are more apt to share the negative then the positive. HOWEVER, I wonder what the people who had negative comments were looking for. This hotel is fun, gorgeous and redefines expectations. When you pull up to the red carpet you realize it will be different. We traveled with our daughter aged 7 and 10. They were catered to and blown away. The public spaces are remarkable and our room a signature suite was up there with the nicest rooms we have ever stayed in. Every inch of the room is well thought out and there are suprises everywhere. The bathroom is worth the trip alone. The little touches were so interesting and the service, from the valets to the concierge were really special. The spa was beautiful and serene with excellent services. They make you feel special with personalization like having your name card waiting for you in the locker when you go change. It would be an amazing romantic getaway, or as we found a great family vacation as well. The Bazaar was unique, as was the vast amount of celebrities just hanging out there. Thanks SLS - Great trip

Reviews.Title: “Very Hip but lacked charm and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: ginakaren
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this very hip hotel which is probably best for people wanting to have a naughty weekend . The rooms are dark al be it modern . Plenty of style but not practical . You can't see what you are doing . The shower is impractical and there is only one hook in the whole place to hang a towel etc... The hand basin tap is ultra modern and also impractical as you do not know whether you are turnig it to hot or cold or what. A few very basic things are forgotten eg. shower caps , soap bars for washing your hands - no there is a hand wash in a squeeze bottle - very unhygenic if you ask me. On check in i specifically asked if the 3 rd floor was suseptible to noise - and the answers came roaring out - of course not - well at 1.00pm at night i was still up with a rowdy party/function going on to which the answer from Steven on the desk was " well madam what would you like me to do about it " but mind you at first he was quite unbeliveing of me and almost incinuating that I was imagining it . The staff are somewhat cool to approch particularly at the reception - consierge is great though - uber modern but lacks class and finess

Reviews.Title: “Room smelled awful, not clean”
Reviews.Author: Will206
Reviews.Content: Our room smelled odd when we checked in, but it was quite late so didn't do anything. When we returned the next evening (again late), the smell was a lot worse (seemed like it was coming from the toilet) - at that point we probably should have packed up all our stuff and requested a new room, but lit a candle instead to mask the smell and went to bed. The next morning we asked them to send an engineer up to fix the problem. When we returned on our last evening, the smell was just as bad. They did comp us for one night of parking and internet access which was nice, but overall would not stay here again for a number of the issues noted in other reviews like the giant plastic soap/shampoo bottles that they refill - I get that it's green, but it's really not hygienic - lack of cleanliness, etc.

Reviews.Title: “New LA Hot SPOT!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ugagirlieMiami
Reviews.Content: Every staff member was accommodating, friendly, happy and all around welcoming - which is important when you are entertaining clients!!!! A hot spot for sure and yet plenty of quiet spots to hide and grab a moment for yourself! A mani/pedi by the pool with a blackberry mojito and your all set!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “SLS Hotel is...UNBELIEVABLE”
Reviews.Author: romalia
Reviews.Content: Do yourself a favor...check this place out. You will not be disappointed. This Alice-in-Wonderland-esq hotel is the perfect spot for a weekend get away or, say...a wedding. (I, myself have done both there.) If you're looking for a space that will amaze you and create an unforgettable experience from the food to the service to the decor, this is it. I had heard about the SLS becuase of all the press coverage about their recent opening. To be honest, we were nervous they would not have any kinks worked out since they were new on the scene. We were also afraid they may be pretentious, expensive, and difficult to work with becuase they cater to a wealthy celebrity clientelle. But, from the moment we stepped inside, we knew we were wrong. This place was unbelievable, the staff was friendly and warm, and the prices were reasonable. The food, staff, service, decor, location, amenities, and ambiance are all top of the line. The design is chic, modern, hip, and eclectic. It's like you've stepped into another world when the doors open. Not only did the place look amazing, but it didn't cost an arm and a leg to stay there. It was $299 per night for a suite in the summer time. Pretty amazing for a five star hotel. And you don't just get a beautifully appointed room for that price. The Spa is so chic and calming. The staff are friendly and inviting and give you one heck of a manicure. The hotel also has an amazing pool surrounded by giant mirrors and beautiful people. The staff are attentive and accomodating and the atmosphere is upbeat but still super chill. You should not miss it. I'm told there's also a great work-out room, but I was too busy eating, drinking, and being married (pun intended) to notice. Maybe next time. And, let's not forget the food. The food is incredible. I've eaten at every restaurant in the hotel, and the food is amazing no matter where you're sitting. The Bazaar is one of the few four star restaurants in LA. Famed chef Jose Andres runs the joint. If you don't know who he is, Google him. You'll see why the food is something to talk about. The restuarant focuses on small plates, but you can get entree sized portions as well. The menu is creative (fois gras cotton candy) and inventive and is incredibly delicious. They have the best bread in the entire world. I don't know what they do to it, but don't miss out on the tomato bread they make. It's to die for and goes perfectly with a charcuterie and cheese plate. Die. The food at our wedding was equally as amazing as if you're dining directly in the Bazaar. We had an assorment of delicious hot and cold appetizers (including a killer mini kobe beef burger) for the cocktail hour. As a kind gesture, Dana Cohen (the catering manager/wedding/event planner/the best thing that ever happened to LA weddings) also threw in a complimentary caprihina (a popular Brazilian beverage) bar for our guests. At dinner we had a tomato, basil, mozzerella salad that was full of flavor and freshness. Next, our guests dined on ribeye or seabass and ended with a chocolate cake. The wine pairings were also perfect. We also had cookies flown in from an Italian bakery in Brooklyn to accompany the complimentary coffee bar after dinner. And then, ater a few hours of dancing, Dana arranged for our guests to enjoy mini gelato cones. Also complimentary. I'm telling you, they really know how to do it right. They don't miss a beat. The entire staff is kind, patient, helpful, friendly, knowledgeable, professional, and had amazing contacts and recommendations. The hotel is also centrally located. You can be shopping and dining in Hollywood or Beverly Hills in minutes, or you can be at the Santa Monica Pier or Downtown LA in a short 20-30 minute car ride. It's the perfect location. I can't even tell you how happy we were to have our wedding at the SLS. Our friends and family are still talking about what an amazing weekend it was. My husband and I wll definitely be back to the hotel for dinner and we even plan on staying another weekend or two a year.., And, I live in LA. If that doesn't tell you what an awesome place this is, then maybe you should check it out for yourself. It's an amazing experience. Go.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: HONkiev
Reviews.Content: I've chosen the SLS hotel because it's a "Luxury Collection" Hotel of SPG of which I'm a Platinum member with 75+ nights/year. I did have very good experience with Luxury Collection Hotels, e.g. the Sheraton Grand in Bangkok - so I did have some expectations when I arrived (even I saw some mixed reviews). To be honest, the best thing about the SLS had been LEAVING this spot. The "cool" SLS hotel is run by a bunch of unprofessional youngsters who know nothing about "luxury" and "service". The hotel is very modern and chic, a bit similar to a nice W hotel of SPG. The lobby is very nice and tasteful. When I checked in I got a room which was nothing else as standard, even I've got Platinum status. Only after I complained I got another room which I would also concider "standard". Since it took too long until my luggage arrived at my room and I had to leave for business I asked them to take out my jackets and hang them. When I returned hours later I've been informed that my luggage is still in the storage room because they didn't know my room number. Can you imagine??? The rooms are pretty dark - and so are the bathrooms. It's a bit complicated to shave... But the biggest mistake is the shower: you can only switch it on while you're under it. Result: you get all the cold water over you. A joke is the bed. The linen has been too shot and therefore the matress the last 10 inch down at the feet had been bare. Disgusting!!! Even you're Platinum member, there's no free water (only a bottle at $10+), no fruits, no chocolates, nothing. The first day I had a bathrobe but then they took it away. Slippers aren't standard (at a Luxury Collection Hotel) but free only upon special request. I like modern hotels, but as I business traveller I request service, that's why I'm staying at a 5* priced hotel. But the SLS is just below Holiday Inn. Btw - Internet is $ 12.95+. My collegues who stay at a cheaper hotel nearby get the internet (and breakfast) for free!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just the very best hotel experience - beautiful atmosphere,friendly helpful staff and great food and drinks”
Reviews.Author: 2louise
Reviews.Content: A beautiful Phillipe Stark Hotel with wonderful staff. Rooms are large but are a little dimly lit - only negative thing I can think to say. Restaurant served excellent food and great drinks and the staff very helpful and friendly. Bazaar restaurant and bar extremely enjoyable. Beautiful food and interesting and great cocktails

Reviews.Title: “SLS IS AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: PRINCIPESSA52
Reviews.Content: So we arrived in Hollywood at our first hotel and were not impressed with the attitude at the front desk of the hotel we originally booked. The hotel had a great rating on trip advisor the rooms were ok but we decided to go with the second hotel picked. We took a taxi drive over to make sure we were making the right decision on changing. As soon as walking in to the SLS we felt that we had found our home for the next 4 days this is what Hollywood should look like and the location was perfect. So after checking in we had a great night the service was great the people were friendly and all of the staff was accomodating. Then next morning there was Tres the restaurant downstairs it had a great breakfast and we totally scored with an incredible waiter Jacob Young he was right about the yogurt I just cannot get over it! The concierge staff was great and always got us where we wanted a special thank-you to K.C.. This hotel is a trendy fantastic hotel and I would recommend for anyone to stay there. Cons yes just a few small ones that are easy to over look they are 2 to be exact they are the big bottles of no name brand refillable shampoos, conditioners, lotions etc. and the fact that they were not enough plugs between Blackberry's and Hair dryers. The locatiopn is Close to tons of shopping walking distance and they even have a house car to take you to Rodeo drive and the other shopping areas. Our trip to LA will be longer next time and we will definately be staying at the SLS cannot wait to see Jacob and the other staff again!

Reviews.Title: “would not return”
Reviews.Author: BayAreaAnna
Reviews.Content: From the moment we entered, we felt like we were in fantasy land. We also were there as our daughter goes to USC. We usually like staying at the Montage, but we thought we would try something else. We also got upgraded for being Starwood Gold level... We put our suitcases in the room and headed upstairs to the restaurant by the pool. Odd to have people smoking next to us. We received two of three of our ordered lunches and they brought my daughter a salad while we waited for her lunch that hadn't been ordered by the waiter...so much for not writing things down. The room was minimalist, dark, and hated the lack of amenities....my husband had to shave by braille! No make up mirrors - no wonder everyone downstairs appears to have black all around their eyes. The next morning, my daughter and I went down for breakfast...cold oatmeal, over done/over-easy eggs and an $8 cup of coffee I would never return. It's back to the Montage...or the Ritz downtown when it opens. We wanted a lovely stay and weren't interested in the cost....instead, we come home very disappointed and happy to sleep in our own home!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! What a hidden treasure!”
Reviews.Author: Texasnacho
Reviews.Content: If you're heading to Los Angeles, I highly recommend the SLS Hotel in Beverly Hills. It is marvelous and the service is outstanding. I found myself enjoying the gorgeous,relaxing pool daily during my stay!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible experience”
Reviews.Author: frequenttravel1
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! The food was great. The rooms were lovely. The service was excellent. For the most part, everything ran smoothly. When things were not quite right, the staff was proactive and rectified the situation immediately to our advantage. This was not the first visit to the hotel and we hope to have many more!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Addition for USC parents”
Reviews.Author: LReego
Reviews.Content: As the choices of 5 star hotels near USC are not extensive (can't wait for the Ritz to open near LA Live!), we thought we'd try the SLS which is 7 miles away to be close to our Trojan water polo playing son. It has a lovely entrance and a nice receiving staff that directs you away from the restaurant (which seems like the hotel entrance) to the actual entrance on the right. The desk help was pretentious but upgraded us to a suite as we are Starwood gold members. The room has a contemporary vibe although overdone with too many mirrors. We also didn't like the shared shampoo/soap/lotion bottles. With viruses an issue, who wants to touch bottles strangers have in the shower? There has to be another way to be earth-friendly (how about pump bottles that can have santitized pumps replaced between guests?) Anyway, the restaurant looked fabulous with cozy, private eating areas. However, we chose to eat at nearby Matsuhisa which was a little crowded (sat us at the sushi bar due to "previous table reservations" which never materialized) and although delicious with good service, way too expensive ($270 for 3 people?). The hotel beds were fine and we like when hotels stretch design to be fresh and exciting. The rooms just aren't as inviting as they could be as the furnishings are a little stark and uncomfortable (and I love modern--it just needs to be more user-friendly). Finally, we are so tired of the $10 waters in the rooms of so many hotels! If a hotel wants to be environmentally conscious, just have filtered water available for free. It's insulting. Just because one has money doesn't make one stupid. Parking was $32 which is the norm in LA.

Reviews.Title: “If you really like yourself...no better place”
Reviews.Author: trojo323
Reviews.Content: Okay, well we're all busy people so I'm going to sum up the good and bad: Pros: Great Fitness Center, Lively/Chic (yet small) roof pool, sophisticated dining options, good sheets, lovely house shuttle, comp. rates Cons: Shared bathroom amenities (full size shampoos and soap bottles), mirror, mirror everywhere, iffy internet connection, front desk staff (slight air of pretense), "free" on-demand TV (free to browse, pay to watch), bath design Okay, I like W's, in my experience, they are a great match of hip swankiness offering a touch of luxury with expected, but typically not found pretense. Actually, most staffers at W's are really as friendly as someone at a Homewood Suites (which is probably one of my favourite brands). The SLS is like a W, in fact, but not really a Luxury Collection Hotel...at least during my stay it definitely had a mover/shaker busybody feel, and whether it was due to the crowds, not sure if property could fulfill expectation, regardless, I found most staffers quite genial, but it only takes 1, in this case my check-in host, to make me question who is the guest and who is the staffer - a smile and hello can go a long way vs. a stiff "may I help you?" Upon checking me in, with his Twilight inspired demeanor, I asked about internet and was told there was a fee, but after re-stating my status, I was told it didn't really apply, since after double checking it was included in room rate. Outside of the shaky start, most of lukewarm reception was due to room design. An odd club-inspired bathroom Most of my other complaints are around the area of getting prepared for the day (or the night) depending on activity. The bathrooms are dark and counter space is limited, almost non-existent due to the kitchen-sized sink in the bathroom. Mirrors abound (even in the shower) so you should be comfortable with your body at all times (even while in the shower). The shower was a bit awkward, at first inspired looking drainage system, but as I showered as the water failed to move down the drawn, I found myself standing in a puddle of water (never fun in any shower). The shower door did not create a watertight seal, so a little water sprayed out through the sides. Oh and lastly I don't understand the concept of shared toiletries -green indeed, but 1) they didn't seem special and 2) how many people have used this bottle of shampoo? Thankfully I travel with usually travel with my own anyway. After the bath, it was time for wardrobe, and well, I was surprised to find a mini iron board available...unfortunately my gnome did not join me on his trip, so I did encounter some challenges with ironing (and once again find a plug for the iron). When you finally did make it out, most of it was good, enjoyed the restaurant immensely, always enjoy roof pools (though 1 was more ornamental than purposeful) and a scene it was (but fully expected), fitness center was phenomenal and the house car and driver were distinguished. Final Outcome That said, it still feels a amalgamation of a lounge and a hotel where style did trump substance and experience (at least from a hotel development standpoint). A very cool hotel, with very posh notes but almost seeming designed by someone who is better tailored for other areas of hospitality or Vegas. True luxury? No. Fun? Sorta. Stay again? Not quite sure- perfect for a stylish Harajuku girls, the Kardashians, and well anyone from Hyde.

Reviews.Title: “TRENDY, COMFORTABLE, GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: AnnieGMiami_Florida
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very centrally located to all the attractions we were interested in visiting, Rodeo Drive, Melrose Ave, The farmers market, etc. The rooms are very spacious and the beds "heavenly". The lighting in the rooms are a bit low and the bathroom features a pedestal bathtub which I found a bit uncomfortable and high to get into. The shower has an overhead showerhead as well as wall showerjets which makes for a great shower experience. Complimentary coffee is served in the lobby area for breakfast. Chocolates and apples are also left in the room at turn down service.The restaurant in the lobby serves breakfast, lunch and dinner and one of the days we had lunch there we spotted Eva Longoria having lunch with a soccer player from a European team which was also staying at the hotel. Adjacent to the Hotel is Spanish chef, Andres Balaz's restaurant "The Bazaar" which is a tapas style restaurant and the food is spectacular. The concierge and the the staff were very attentive and helpful with the many questions we had about the area and the valet staff offered us water and directions also. The days we were there the hotel was very busy with the Soccer Team that was staying there but at no time did we feel that we were any less important or that we were not able to get the service that we needed. I would recommend this hotel to people that like trendy, hot spots combined with great comfort and convenience of location. Many restaurants within walking distance as well as shopping areas, movies etc.

Reviews.Title: “Scene in Beverly Hills...doesn't live up to the hype”
Reviews.Author: EYtraveller
Reviews.Content: I just recently stayed at the SLS for 7 nights on a business trip. My girlfriend flew in from New York for 4 days so this trip was work/pleasure. We were excited to stay at the SLS in Beverly HIlls, it was even on Entourage. I arrived on a Thursday night and could not pull into the entrance of the hotel. The driveway was packed with Ferrari's, Bentleys, and Roll Royce's. The entrance is small and impractical. There is no self parking, only valet ( $35 a night). The valet attendants are decent, and if you call down ahead of time they have your car waiting with a bottle of water in ti. The hotel is located on La Cienega in Beverly hills about .3 miles from WIlshire Blvd and two miles from Rodeo Drive. There is a lot of traffic to get to the hotel and it is tough to get in the small entrance coming from either direction. I was not a fan of the location. The room was ultra-modern with sliding mirror doors in the bathroom and plasma tv behind a mirror. The king bed was floating in the center of the room with a desk behind it. There was not enough room to sit in the chair at the desk comfortably. The room had interesting lighting and a terrace, but overall was too small. It was clean, nice but small. The bathroom was nice and had a large shower with great water pressure. There is no bath tub. The hotel provides full size shampoo, conditioner, face wash etc which is nice. I liked the bath products. The beds are comfortable as well. The hotel has very nice fitness center with all new modern equipment. There are treadmills, ellipticals, bikes, and stair machines. There are also dumbells up to 50 lbs and machines. Water and towels are provided. All the aerobic machines have tvs in them. The rooftop pool is nice. It has a great view. The regular pool is heated ,but the salt water pool isnt. The lounge chairs are comfortable and there are cabanas. Food and drinks can be ordwered but during the week take time. The concierge services were helpful. The hotel has a fleet of cars that can drive you around the area. Each floor also has a pool table by the elevators ( kind of cool) The restaurant Bazaar is the hottest restaurant in LA. The food is very good. Small plates that add up to a fairly large bill. My gf and I had dinner Saturday night and the bill was over $300. We tried alof of the food and enjoyed the experience. It is by no means the best restaurant ive been to, its a good restaurant. Bar scene is fantastic if your into that sort of thing. This place is a mob all night on Wednesday thru Saturday. Definitely make a reservation, its worth trying it out. Especially the dessert patisserie after your meal Overalll the SLS is a good hotel. The faciltiy is good but I found the service to be just ok. I get much better service at W Hotels. This hotel is not on par with the Four Seasons or Mandarin Orientals etc. Add to the fact the hotel is a huge night scene and can be crowded. I was not impressed nor will I be returning to hotel. I will stay at the Four Seasons or the W Westwood.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite experience. Friendliest staff in the hotel world”
Reviews.Author: kodiak33
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to the SLS for several months now. I have received nothing but the best regarding service and hospitatlity. You have some top notch employees- including Ashley and Lewis at the front desk, Stephanie and Irene in the restaurant/lounge, Jacob and the entire wait staff. It has been a true pleasure to be a guest at the SLS.

Reviews.Title: “Style trumps substance”
Reviews.Author: veryhardtoplease
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights on business, having tried other hotels in Beverly Hills and still not having found one that ticks all the boxes. I would quantify this hotel as 'too cool for school'. It's very hip, with a fashionable young clientele, and the mood is definitely cool. The restaurant (self styled as the only four star in LA) is worth trying, my room was comfortable (once you've figured out how everything works) and the pool top bar is great. The only real let down is inconsistent service: they had loaned out all the European plug adapters and when asked if they could get more, they suggested sending someone out and charging me for it; I had to call four times to get shoes sent for shining returned; the queue at check out was three deep (ie 10 mins wait) with only one young girl working reception and no other staff attempting to step in. These are small gripes, but this is supposed to be a five star hotel. The price is fine (I paid $379 per night plus taxes) and I would probably stay there again, hoping that things are running more smoothly when they've had more time to gain experience.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: sonyabfine
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the SLS Hotel for business. Upon my arrival I was greeted by the most courtious doormen. My registartion was fast and problem free. My room was spacious,clean, and cozy. The shower and tub were my most favorite features. I attended a "Meet & Greet" in the hotel lounge and eat an amazing assortment of appitizer. Mini burgers cooked to perfection by Morton's The Steakhouse, jacima filled with guacamole, and another dish infused with liquid mozzarella, very "Top Chief." The staff made me feel like royalty. The location was great and Iprobably would have enjoyed it more , if I had been more familiar with Beverly Hills. I will definately tell my familiy and friends about this amazing little jewel in Beverly Hills.

Reviews.Title: “Magic Kitchen!”
Reviews.Author: mr-financial
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel several times while in BH on business, unaware of the culinary delight that happened to reside in my hotel (or home for the night) and what wonderful delights can come from the kitchen. If you wait long enough, you will find thoughtful and inspired fare such as the quail eggs and quince with tomato sauce heaped upon some really tasty mashed potatoes. The bacon as crisp and cooked as desired as anyone can ask for. Fresh water mellon juice tops it off with a smile on your face as you leave breakfast-the hotel is fantastic as well, and supports this restaurants quirky but usually spot on merging of the moose and the mouse, or the strange and the really strange-or just seemingly odd.......but by the time you're on your third expertly prepared mojito, it's all good. You leave happy, and value to money is high-on both fronts. High value, but not especially cheap-but for the best Serrano Ham I've had in the States, it's worth it perhaps? The good news is that this same (not all of it, but enough to get a clue of what awaits those who love good food) to the menu on the room service menu. While it's not the full compliment that you will find in the restaurant, it's a nice selection-and for room service, it kicks a**. I have had my fair share of 2am room service, and this is amongst the best I've seen. It not only reflects the quality of the kitchen, but moreover a synergy of executing the experience and getting it to the guest (me). This "synergy" is not a foregone conclusion and should be expected at properties at a level as the SLS and they deliver where many hotels fail in this seemingly minor detail. Then the California factor, there are some "colorful" individuals here-including the sometimes less than savory behavior of its guests for which it is not responsible. But certain well heeled guests can dress in what I view as non-standard for a luxury resort, but it's California hey.........but when an eccentric old man leads you to a seat and 20 minutes later no hostess comes to check on you, one can wonder if in fact he's not part of the colorful if not useful background-it crosses borders-but as a SPG Platinum customer at an excellent restaurant-how do you take ownership of "vibe"......this is a challenge. But sacrificing on service is a bad approach as I found this to be much as leaving condiments that may accompany burgers and such (e.g. mayo) off the menu is a pointless error-it's easy to do right. That said, I have witnessed the hotel security usher out those who required it, or coached others into inspiring good examples of behavior-and in Los Angeles-this can tough-big egos out there. Perhaps this is why they wisely outlawed liquor out on the front porch. But I am impressed with most aspects of this place

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel has a head for business, but a body for sin”
Reviews.Author: PepeRivas2
Reviews.Content: Great building, great service at the door and also good management: they came back when I start claiming, but they failed miserably on details. The rooms are too dark, they don't replace drinks when you take them in your room, it took three days to recover the chips I ate the first day, they lost on cloth in the laundry, there were spy nets in one of the windows that took two days to clean completely, the bathroom was loosing water the first night, making noise all night, we were three colleagues in three different rooms at the Hotel, but with one car, and they pretended to charge parking to each of us. Good that we told each other, because we had different departures dates!. Once we told them, they took the parking charge out of the invoice. As I said: failed miserably on details, because they responded when we claimed, and the rest of the hotel was great. Great lobby, great gym, small pool and very good at the recepcion helping us in finding and making reservations on restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Design that is trying too hard / Staff that isn't...”
Reviews.Author: Pete312
Reviews.Content: The SLS Beverly Hills (Starwood) is trying so hard to be a hip hotel. The design (by Phillipe Starck?) is completely silly. My room has no electrical outlets any where near my desk - had to get maintenance to run a big organge cord across the room. But, there is techno gym built in one wall. I get the impression that the philosophy is "add, add, add!" there is stuff everywhere (fine line between trendy design and a bad Cheesecake Factory btw). The staff is very pretty but they seem to be "playing hotel" The prices are very high and the location is not prime. I can not recommend this hotel - so many better options in Beverly Hills / Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Great service in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: gradyjewel
Reviews.Content: The service is outstanding. Everyone who works at the hotel is polite, knowledgeable and accommodating. Our room was immaculate. The hotel is within walking distance to shopping and restaurants and the local car service provided by the hotel is an added convenience. The restaurant, Tres, has excellent food. We ate both breakfast and dinner there. We would definitely stay at the SLS again and recommend it to our friends. The only drawback is that the outside sitting area is very smoky. It is not pleasant for those of us who do not smoke, yet want to people watch and have a cocktail with family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “i want to live here”
Reviews.Author: Jina72
Reviews.Content: This has been my second stay at the SLS and my only choice for hotel in LA. The service right from the doorman to the banquet staff, is superb. This is by far the best hotel in North America...I frequent hotels throughout mostly the U.S. and some in Canada approximately 30x a year and nothing comes close to the stay at the SLS. The food is superb, drinks are superb, the gym is state of the art and opened 24hrs. The rooms are so luxurious. If you want to be pampered this is the place even while on business. The restaurant won't dissappoint and if you want something quieter, the in-room dining will not fail you.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like a celebrity”
Reviews.Author: Scabbardgirl
Reviews.Content: I was in L.A. for a wedding. I decided to stay at the SLS because it's concept intrigued me. I'm not a 20-something, but I do like the atmosphere of the W Hotels and this hotel was supposed to be a "W on steriods" so to speak. I have to say that I was totally impressed with the SLS. To me, it is a luxury hotel that has no trouble making fun of it's luxury moniker. My room was very nice. I loved that bed and the TV in the mirror. I loved the bathroom. Yes, it's dark, but I had no problem with that. There was a lighted makeup mirror on the table to help out. I really wish I could take that whole room and transplant it into my house - it's what I'd like as my master suite at home! I was treated like a celebrity by all staff I encountered, from the valets who graciously took my red rental Ford from me and didn't make me feel like a commoner, to the front desk who greeted me and acknowledged my SPG status. They even asked if I would like a late checkout, which I was going to ask for (it's usually like pulling teeth to get a late c/o). I really enjoyed the outdoor lounge at the guest entrance - comfy chairs to sit and watch the people coming and going. The location of the SLS was just fine for me. I got to walk over to Beverly Center for some shopping (boy has that mall changed for the better!!). It was a short drive up to Hollywood to meet up with some friends and eat a Roscoe's. I wish I had more time to spend at the hotel that time. If I get back to L.A., I will be sure to check for a room at the SLS. It's definitely not for everyone, but for those who can have a sense of humor and are not expecting a stuffy "luxury" hotel, it's a great place. If you want stuffy luxury, try another high-end hotel in L.A. , like Raffles or the Penninsula.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated for a luxury collection-- very "W"-like atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: stircrazyinNJ
Reviews.Content: I was not impressed with the SLS hotel. I am a Platinum Starwood member and have stayed at numerous hotels. I should caveat that I prefer Westins to Ws in terms of style. The SLS is certainly swanky, but it didn't have a Luxury Collection feel. The pool was beautiful, but open very late in the morning, so not practical for business travellers or folks from the west coast.

Reviews.Title: “Suspect, Lackluster, Sable”
Reviews.Author: pangea2
Reviews.Content: Should be the preferred definition for SLS. Outside of the quick to appear valet people, little to no attention is given to guests. The rooms are dark (not cool dark, just so dark one cannot shave or even determine the need to shave nor can you read anywhere in the room). Key card readers in the elevators apparently make up for security personnel but do not work well and it was obvious we were followed by lobby lizard types that pushed the pool button after we put our card in the slot. TV selection is not too cool either and might be considered standard for a Sheraton. Not at all sure what makes up the pretense of luxury here at all. No newspaper option (USA Today, period), AM coffee in the lobby seemed to be available at the whim of staff, without a specific time frame; usually, only one person at the desk, with another talking over a very audible walkie-talkie; one bellman; no security; Stark designed furniture and fixtures that are â€œcoolâ€� but implausible for real use. Wi-Fi is at the high-end price point of other Starwood hotels and silly (no, not hip). Clearly it is the bar business they (SBE) are into and know how to operate, though here too, the emphasis on being a celebrity heaven overwhelms regular customersâ€™ satisfaction. On the positive side, the gym is a comfortable size with quality Techno machines. Sad, limited and senseless is what you get for a pretentious price point.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Funky Fun Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GetAroundGirly
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a mother/daughter weekend. My girls were charmed by this hotel and thought it was cool, funky and fun! I though had a great deal of trouble, turning on the bath, lights and basically finding my way around the room. for anyone over 40, beware you may need a manual if you haven't your teenagers with you. All in all a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The more money you pay the worse the service”
Reviews.Author: Granger9999
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice besides the fact that you need to bring your own flashlight. The service is horrible. The pool area is to small and it seems like most of the people hanging out there are not from the hotel. I shouldnt have to pay to sit down at the hotel pool because the young hollywood crowd is partying there for the day and taking up all the chairs. If there were guests that would be one thing but they were not. As a platnium member i get great service at all SPG properties. Except for this trendy spot.. Give me a Westin or a W anyday....

Reviews.Title: “Simply Luxurious Surroundings”
Reviews.Author: VancityVoyageur
Reviews.Content: LA...bright lights, beautiful people and glamour. My friends and I had never been to LA before and since our friend recently moved there and was getting married we figured it would be a great opportunity for a bachelor party. Upon arrival we were greeted by numerous staff at Valet Parking, the main door, and the front desk. Checking in was a breeze and we entered our room to find simple yet tasteful and modern decor. We got cleaned up and headed down to Tres where the bartender took good care of us and even took back a drink I wasn't satisfied with and made it right, no problem! 5 cocktails later we wandered over to Bazaar where the concierge was supposed to have made a reservation for our party. Unfortunately they didn't have our name on the list (tsk tsk Casey, I even confirmed before flying in with your colleague...) Fortunately Thierry, a gracious french host, consulted briefly with Joey the dashing Italian manager and had us seated very quickly. The night took off from there and we left hammered, full of food and memories from a wonderful night. Thanks go to Andrew, our server, as he had his hands full with us! The next day while the amateurs slept off the hangover I went for breakfast around the corner and came back to the SLS to enjoy the weather and pool. WOW! It was wonderful! The service was great as were the surroundings and I had a great time meeting new people poolside! When I returned to the room the friendly housekeeping staff asked if we would like more time and we said yes :) The afternoon was spent at the beach and the evening at a local nightclub. Sunday we checked out no problem and jetted away back home with many fond memories of LA and particularly the SLS! The beds were simply divine in my opinion. I slept as good as I did at home. The rooms were roomy enough and the bathrooms were fantastic. Loved the shower! Temperature controls in the room were great and very responsive. Too hot? Turn it down and within a minute or two it's where you want it to be. Staff? All very friendly and attentive. No complaints and we had a nice time chatting with quite a few employees who as it were double duty in the Hotel/Resto/Pool etc. One was even a trained opera singer and serenaded us at the end of the night Friday! A real southern belle from Alabama and a looker to boot :) Intangibles? Well, let's just say this Hotel was featured in Entourage...Lots of beautiful, friendly people from all over and we all enjoyed socializing at Bazaar. There were always half a dozen Italian/German/British luxury cars in the parking lot which was fun. Not sure about all the negative reviews vis a vis the handles in the rooms and staining because our room looked brand new. All in all we LOVED our stay and will definitely be back, recommend the Hotel to others and think back fondly on our stay! Big thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Truly unique”
Reviews.Author: lebelgo
Reviews.Content: I had the good fortune to stay here essentially for free on Starwood's "Stay two nights, get a week-end night free" promo (I paid only for parking). The hotel definitely makes a good first impression. The service was quite professional, and despite looking a tad grungy after our day at Universal Studios, and despite coming in on a "free" night, I was made to feel like an honored Gold SPG guest. I was told that instead of the handicapped room the SPG phone rep said I would have to settle for, I would get an upgraded room on the top (7th) floor, and my internet and room water would be complimentary as an SPG Gold guest. I did not at all get this courtesy when I checked in for my free night at the Niagara Falls' Sheraton Fallsview hotel. I have one more free night pending at the Zuerich Sheraton, and we'll see. The hotel is immaculately clean and well-maintained, albeit pretty dark everywhere, including the rooms, as many have commented before. Every floor has a pool table, although one has to go to the front desk to get the equipment, and I suspect they're mostly for show. Most floors also have "portraits" which morph from men to apes or monkeys. I had a reasonable Hollywood Hills view from my room. The rooms are visually striking. There are multiple etched-glass drinking glasses of various colors in the room, as well as full-sized bottles of multiple soaps (body, face, hand, etc.). While some people commented on getting sprayed on when turning on the shower, it is actually possible to direct the flow to the opposite wall. The "mini-bar" is actually a full bar with full-sized bottles of fairly premium liquor, such as Patron tequila, and Russian Standard vodka. No prices were marked, and I assumed this to be a case of "If you have to ask you can't afford it." As others have pointed out, the lighting is rather poor, and one of the weaknesses of the room. Another was the hard-cornered metal framing under the mattresses. I bumped my shins on it. I thought I was just being clumsy, perhaps, but my partner did the same thing, so this is one of the instances of "form over function." Another example of "form over function" was exemplified by the pools. One of the pools is literally only 1 foot deep (30 cm), and the other 3' 6" (a bit over a meter). If I were paying over $300/night for a room, I think I'd want a pool one could actually swim in. The gym, on the other hand, is possibly the largest hotel gym I've ever seen, certainly for a hotel of such modest size. The business center, too, is very adequate for the hotel's size. Unlike some hotels which have 2 or 3 terminals, this hotel has a whole array for guests' use. This is one of the most unusual hotel's I've ever stayed in. It's one of the most visually interesting, albeit perhaps not one of the most functional hotels in which I've stayed. I can see why some love it and some hate it. From the prices I've seen online, I think one could probably do better for the money, but it is handsome and has some nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Austere”
Reviews.Author: Capricorn2400
Reviews.Content: A hotel that allowed a designer to build a hotel. Not enough electrical outlets, a tub with a shower curtain...no shelf to keep soap and shampoo, ergo water on the floor. Had an uncomfortable bench disguised as a couch. You can make martinis in the room, but doesn't have a mini-bar w/food. A little more modern than we prefer.

Reviews.Title: “Very interesting hotel with good service.Not for everyone-but great for me!”
Reviews.Author: bigguyinpasadena
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night here and really enjoyed myself. Interesting design elements and you will DEFINATELY know you are"not in Kansas anymore"! Service was warm and friendly.Room was very spacious with an outdoor private seating area. The public areas are so full of interesting things.Really a special place. With the above being said this is NOT a hotel for everyboody-and that is just the way I like it. I stay in a lot of"nice"hotels and am thrilled to have a place that is sophisticated and aimed at a "grown ups only"market. I look forward to my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money or ruin your holiday by staying at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sydney_AustraliaLily
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights at this hotel with my husband and 8 year old son. We travel frequently, and have stayed at beautiful hotels in Australia, Asia and Europe- thus we KNOW what constitutes good service and that is where this hotel fails miserably. 1. We called ahead to see when our room would be ready for our arrival. We were still jetlagged from a long flight from Sydney, Australia, so we were looking forward to relaxing in a lovely hotel room. We were told 3pm. We arrived at 3pm only to be informed that the room wasn't ready, and we could go up to the pool deck and wait. Up we went. It was absolutely stinking hot up there. Shade is extremely limited, as is service. The waitstaff were very young and seemingly lacking the knowledge of how to properly look after guests. We sat and waited and waited and waited. In the heat. With a small boy. My husband ended up finally getting a young guy to take our order for a drink. And we waited and waited and waited some more. Finally the drinks came, and rather small and stingy they were. Anyway, we ended up waiting for our room until it was almost 5pm by which time we were completely fed up and wondering if we should simply go to another hotel. As we were leaving to finally go to our room, we were presented with a bill for $65 for our drinks. We thought this was a bit rich, and asked for this to be taken off the bill when we checked out 2 days later. If this hotel is going to be so slow in ensuring rooms are ready by a given time, then herd unwitting guests onto the steaming hot pool deck- of course management should show a bit of goodwill and at least offer a couple of complimentary drinks! 2. The rooms are ridiculously dark. 3. The only possible way to get food in this hotel is to order to your room. The restaurant is either fully booked or shut. We tried to get some tapas in the restaurant one afternoon, and were shown to a table. No one came back to take our order. It was absolutely incredible. I've NEVER seen anything as inept as the service in this hotel!! We waited and waited and waited. The waiter didn't return, so we left. Funny thing was, as we left the waiter was hovering about at the door and asked "Going already?" (really surprised) and we responded with "Yes- why would we hang around when you're clearly not going to serve us??" So stupid, it's almost funny. 4. I really resented the message on every bill I signed for room service" "For your convenience we have added an 18% gratuity to your bill"... or something similiar. Where does this place get off helping themselves to MORE of your hard-earned money??? Then we really didn't want to tip the staff bringing the food to our room. One guy threw a mini-tantrum and snatched the bill folder from my husband's hand and knocked my coffee over when it became clear he wasn't going to get a tip. I'd like to give this hotel a TIP: TIPS ARE MEANT TO BE GIVEN IN GRATITUDE FOR GOOD, PROFESSIONAL SERVICE. THIS HOTEL DOES NOT OFFER THIS. The few positives about this hotel would be: 1. The linen on the bed is lovely. The beds are extremely comfortable. Mmmmm... I can't actually think of any other positive aspect of this hotel. I have certainly told friends and family to avoid staying here. Go somewhere a bit more traditional. Somewhere that mightn't be as "cool" or "hip" as this place, but at least you feel as if you're being looked after by people who know what they're doing.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Jessica46
Reviews.Content: Staying at the SLS was the best experience I have had so far with the luxury Starwood hotels. The room was very clean and created a sense of relaxation and privacy. Service was prompt and professional. Most of the other guests that I encountered seemed to range in age from their mid 20s to 30 somethings. We arrived on a Sunday, and the partying was still going on at the pool. There are always those few people that have to get wasted, and make themselves look foolish, but the staff took care of the drunk idiots quite quickly. When I come back to LA I will be looking forward to staying at this hotel again. I am happy that I am unable to find much of anything to complain about at this amazing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Like Marmite - You'll either love it or hate it.....”
Reviews.Author: SarniaCI
Reviews.Content: This is certainly not a dull place to stay - on the positive side the location is excellent, situated close to The Beverly Hills Center. The hotel offered an excellent valent parking service and there was an interestingly framed roof top pool serving superb food with very attentive and friendly staff. The rooms were a good size, the linen wonderful and the bathrooms large if somewhat bizzare in design. There was also a well equiped fitness centre. On the negative, the hotel "concept" was definitely a case of design over functionality - as with the Hudson in New York, guests should be provided with a flash-light/torch to navigate this hotel as lighting does not appear to be top of Phillippe Starck's priority list and why would anyone place a pool table in a communal area on each and every floor unless hotel management was actively encouraging its guests to stay up all night - in which case, this was an unnecessary step as the noise from the lobby party-bar was more than sufficient. The reception staff had a problem understanding that they were the ones supposed to be serving the guests (rather than the other way round) and the roof top pool should be avoided at the weekend unless you are a would be starlet auditioning for Lolita. The bedrooms lacked lighting and storage was sufficient only for those packing size zero clothing and going commando. That said, if you are looking for a party hotel to hang out with the beautiful people then this is the place for you. Overall, we enjoyed our stay mainly as there was an amusing incident lurking behind every doorway. But horses for courses as they say and this was probably just not a hotel for this particular filly. Would I recommend this hotel to friends - well if they could get a good rate, left their children at home and promised to pack a sense of humour then probably yes.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressive Hotel, Amazing Restaurant & Super Friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Author: THEGUYFROMSOCALIF
Reviews.Content: I am an SPG Platinum member and usually get upgraded to beautiful suites as a matter of course, especially within my home state of CA. For the first time this year, that did not happen at this hotel - not a junior suite, basically no upgrade at all for my platinum status (and this was my very special anniversary night with my wife), so I would normally be a bit disappointed with the situation. But, I believe the front desk folks were genuine when they told me they had no upgrade rooms available for this particular night and Peggy promised me a beautiful suite upgrade next time I want to come back (which I will next month). So, as for the hotel... simply amazing. Here are bullet points about the stay: (1) There is something in the air here at this hotel, where you just know you are part of a very special hotel. Hard to describe other than a very positive vibe; (2) The staff is incredibly friendly. Before we dined at Bizarre, Lucas Paya took the time to put together his recommended menu for the evening for us!! And, he picked some dishes we would have never selected and they were incredible - such as traditional and modern olives, the "Philly Cheesesteak", the "hanger steak" - our favorite dish from the (9) items we ate in all! We did not get to the dish made with cotton candy - we are saving it to come back next month with the kids!! The staff at the pool was super friendly as well - not to mention the room service staff. And, of course, Peggy, who truly felt bad that she could not do any better for us (roon wise) on our special night and told us to speak to her directly before setting up our next visit (can't wait); (3) The restaurant - "Bizarre" - I believe one of only 2 restaurants in LA that has received a "five star" rating from the LA Times(??) or something like that - and we quickly found out why! If you want an incredible experience in dining - don't miss this restaurant! We ordered (9) items in all and with tax, tip, drinks and all included our bill was under $140 - not cheap, but certainly not expenisve by any "LA" measure; (4) The room was clean, great bed, TV that is part of the mirrored wall, large bottles of shampoo, etc., access to nice pool tables on every floor; (5) good location - an easy 1 block walk to the Beverly Center mall, a Mortons right next door, easy access to all the local attractions; (5) Nightlife inside the hotel - WOW. What a "happening" bar/lounge. Bottle service at around $300/bottle, special drinks with liquid nitrogen(?), beautiful people - my wife and I commented how much fun we would have had at this bar (20) years ago (LOL). Overall, a wonderful stay. If you want to treat yourself to something special - don't miss this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad experience”
Reviews.Author: pindundu
Reviews.Content: I was there for 2 nights with my wife and 9 years boy. The hotel is nice and well decorated (modern style). However, the location is very bad as you cannot go anywhere in Beverly Hills without using your car. Then, the service is terrible: nodoby to open the hotel doors even if you're carrying your luggage! When we came back to our room at 7 pm, the room was not done! We went out for dinner and I kindly asked the reception that I'd like to have my room cleaned when we're back. At 11pm, when we came back, same situation... I called the reception and they send someone to clean our room, but no excuse, no inviation to a drink while we were waiting, just disgusting! The food (tapas style) at the restaurant was really bad and overpriced. NEVER AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “Shocked that they would not honor their commitment to their rates during our stay.”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaCat1
Reviews.Content: We called ahead to book using a rate they had posted online - discounted rate for the first two nights, third night free. When we called before we came, they said that we should just talk to the front desk on the morning of the third day. Well, it's the morning of the third day and now they are saying that we were booked differently so they can't honor the third night free. We were planning on staying until the end of the week, but they said that their rates could change "like the airlines" so now I'm concerned about the bill we would receive at the end. For such a high-end hotel, I'm really surprised that they would haggle over rates rather focusing on overall customer satisfaction, loyalty and advocacy.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sweetie27
Reviews.Content: This is my first review on tripadvisor because I felt everyone needs to know this before spending any money on this hotel. Their service is horrible, they do everything in their power to ruin your experience. The pool is exteremy small and the staff is unfriendly and rude. The concierge is very forgetful about what they promise to do. The staff is not knowlegable about hotel policy.

Reviews.Title: “fun, yet sophisticated”
Reviews.Author: pillowsofwanderlust
Reviews.Content: Just enjoyed an in-town getaway here. We wanted a base from which we could reexplore such shopping/dining areas as: the Beverly Center, The Grove/Farmer's Market, Third St., Robertson Blvd., Melrose Ave., La Cienega Blvd., and Beverly Blvd. The choice came down to the SLS and the Sofitel; the new Montage Beverly Hills was enticing but too far west. We opted for the SLS because it is newer, a Starwood Luxury Collection property, nightlife guru Sam Nazarian's first hotel, and home to The Bazaar by Jose Andres, only the second restaurant to ever receive the highest four star rating from the Los Angeles Times (the first, Bastide, is now closed). Monkeys are the SLS's mascots because, a front desk staffer told me, they are "fun, yet sophisticated", which is the hotel's aim. Designed by Philippe Starck with typical whimsy, humour and modern style (sometimes at the expense of practicality or function), the hotel also tries to provide a high level of service. For the most part, it succeeds. The staff is young, friendly and largely professional, but certainly less formal than at a Peninsula or Four Seasons. On weekends, there are lots of young partying beautiful guests usurping the pool and restaurant/bar, causing commotion in the hallways and rooms (think HBO's "Entourage"), but come Sunday, the place settles down. There are separate entrances to The Bazaar and hotel, which has its own quiet restaurant, Tres. The hotel's lobby lounge is actually outdoors. Typical Starck touches abound--mismatched furniture everywhere, long tall communal tables in the restaurants, mismatched glassware in the rooms, all varieties of chandeliers and huge mirrors. The front desk area is dark. The meeting rooms are named after famous monkeys. A room key is needed to ascend any elevator. Each floor has a pool table with a silver floor lamp shaped like a rifle. Throughout the lobby and restaurant are myriads of shelves filled with books and tchotchkes--a housekeeping nightmare! THE ROOM. I had reserved a veranda room, but the very accommodating receptionist quickly upgraded me to a Signature Suite with terrace when no veranda rooms were available. It was large and so very chic. The terrace rooms all seem to be on the 2nd floor with the terraces exiting onto 3 different garden courtyards.
